questions.question: Which of the following is <italic>not</italic> a common cloud service model?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Programming as a Service is not a common offering; the others are ubiquitous throughout the industry.

questions.question: All of the following technologies have made cloud service viable except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Virtualization allows scalable resource allocation; broadband connections allow users to have remote access from anywhere; cryptographic connections allow for secure remote access. Smart hubs aren't widely used in cloud offerings.

questions.question: Cloud vendors are held to contractual obligations with specified metrics by:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Service level agreements (SLAs) specify objective measures that define what the cloud provider will deliver to the customer.

questions.question: _____ drive security decisions.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Security is usually not a profit center, and is therefore beholden to business drivers; the purpose of security is to support the business.

questions.question: If a cloud customer cannot get access to the cloud provider, this affects what portion of the CIA triad?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Lack of access is an availability issue.

questions.question: Cloud Access Security Brokers (CASBs) might offer all of the following services EXCEPT:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Business Continuity Planning (BCP) / Disaster Recovery (DR) / Continuity of Operations Plan (COOP)

questions.explanation: Cloud Access Security Brokers (CASBs) don't usually offer Business Continuity Planning (BCP) / Disaster Recovery (DR) / Continuity of Operations Plan (COOP) services; that's something offered by cloud providers

questions.question: Encryption can be used in various aspects of cloud computing, including all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The data on magnetic swipe cards isn't usually encrypted.

questions.question: All of the following are reasons an organization may want to consider cloud migration except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Risks, in general, can be reduced but never eliminated; cloud service, specifically, does not eliminate risk to the cloud customer, because the customer retains a great deal of risk after migration

questions.question: The generally accepted definition of cloud computing includes all of the following characteristics except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Backups are still just as important as ever, regardless of where your primary data and backups are stored.

questions.question: A gamer is part of the PlayStation Network community cloud. Who owns the PlayStation console in the gamer’s home?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: The company that made the game that the gamer is playing at the time

questions.explanation: The gamer owns the console in their home. The gamer can turn it on and off at their discretion, sell it, or smash it with a hammer. The various members of a community cloud can all share the underlying resources of the community cloud as they choose. In this case, Sony, the game maker, the gamer, and the other players are all members of the community, and all share different underlying components as they choose.

questions.question: The risk that a cloud provider might go out of business and the cloud customer might not be able to recover data is known as:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: This is the definition of vendor lock out.

questions.question: All of the following are features of cloud computing except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: This is a nonsense term used as a red herring.

questions.question: When a cloud customer uploads Personally identifiable information (PII) to a cloud provider, who becomes ultimately responsible for the security of that Personally identifiable information (PII)?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: The individuals who are the subjects of the Personally identifiable information (PII)

questions.explanation: Under current law, the data owner is responsible for any breaches that result in unauthorized disclosure of Personally identifiable information (PII); this includes breaches caused by contracted parties and outsources services. The data owner is the cloud customer.

questions.question: We use which of the following to determine the critical paths, processes, and assets of an organization?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The Business impact analysis (BIA) is designed to ascertain the value of the organization's assets, and learn the critical paths and processes.

questions.question: The cloud deployment model that features organizational ownership of the hardware and infrastructure, and usage only by members of that organization, is known as:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: This is the definition of a private cloud model.

questions.question: The cloud deployment model that features ownership by a cloud provider, with services offered to anyone who wants to subscribe, is known as:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: This is the definition of a public cloud model.

questions.question: The cloud deployment model that features joint ownership of assets among an affinity group is known as:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: This is the definition of a community cloud model.

questions.question: If a cloud customer wants a secure, isolated sandbox in order to conduct software development and testing, which cloud service model would probably be best?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Platform as a Service (PaaS) allows the cloud customer to install any kind of software, including software to be tested, on an architecture that includes any desired OSs.

questions.question: If a cloud customer wants a fully operational environment with very little maintenance or administration necessary, which cloud service model would probably be best?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Software as a Service (SaaS) is the most comprehensive cloud offering, requiring little input and administration on the part of the cloud customer.

questions.question: If a cloud customer wants a barebones environment in which to replicate their own enterprise for Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) purposes, which cloud service model would probably be best?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) offers what is basically a hot/warm DR site, with hardware, connectivity, and utilities, allowing the customer to build out any kind of software configuration (including choosing OSs).

questions.question: Gathering business requirements can aid the organization in determining all of this information about organizational assets, except:
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: When we gather information about business requirements, we need to do a complete inventory, receive accurate valuation of assets (usually from the owners of those assets), and assess criticality; this collection of information does not tell us, objectively, how useful an asset is, however.

questions.question: The Business impact analysis (BIA) can be used to provide information about all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: The Business impact analysis (BIA) gathers asset valuation information that is beneficial for risk analysis and selection of security controls (it helps avoid putting the ten dollar lock on the five dollar bicycle), and criticality information that helps in Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) planning by letting the organization understand which systems, data, and personnel are necessary to continuously maintain. However, it does not aid secure acquisition efforts, since the assets examined by the Business impact analysis (BIA) have already been acquired.

questions.question: In which cloud service model is the customer required to maintain the OS?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: In Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), the service is bare metal, and the customer has to install the OS and the software; the customer then is responsible for maintaining that OS. In the other models, the provider installs and maintains the OS.

questions.question: In which cloud service model is the customer required to maintain and update only the applications?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: In Platform as a Service (PaaS), the provider supplies the hardware, connectivity, and OS; the customer installs and maintains applications. In Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), the customer must also install the OS, and in Software as a Service (SaaS), the provider supplies and maintains the applications.

questions.question: In which cloud service model is the customer only responsible for the data?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Software as a Service (SaaS) is the model in which the customer supplies only the data; in the other models, the customer also supplies the OS, the application, or both.

questions.question: The cloud customer and provider negotiate their respective responsibilities and rights regarding the capabilities and data of the cloud service. Where is the eventual agreement codified?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The contract codifies the rights and responsibilities of the parties involved upon completion of negotiation. The Risk Management Framework (RMF) aids in risk analysis and design of the environment. An Memorandum of understanding (MOU) is shared between parties for a number of possible reasons. The Business impact analysis (BIA) aids in risk assessment, DC/BR efforts, and selection of security controls.

questions.question: In attempting to provide a layered defense, the security practitioner should convince senior management to include security controls of which type?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Layered defense calls for a diverse approach to security.

questions.question: Which of the following is considered an administrative control?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: A process is an administrative control; sometimes, the process includes elements of other types of controls (in this case, the access control mechanism might be a technical control, or it might be a physical control), but the process itself is administrative. Keystroke logging is a technical control (or an attack, if done for malicious purposes, and not for auditing); door locks are a physical control; and biometric authentication is a technological control. This is a tricky question.

questions.question: Which of the following is considered a technological control?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: A firewall is a technological control. The safe and extinguisher are physical controls, and firing someone is an administrative control.

questions.question: Which of the following is considered a physical control?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Fences are physical controls; carpets and ceilings are architectural features, and a door is not necessarily a control: the lock on the door would be a physical security control. Although you might think of a door as a potential answer, the best answer is the fence; the exam will have questions where more than one answer is correct, and the answer that will score you points is the one that is most correct.

questions.question: In a cloud environment, encryption should be used for all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Near term storage of virtualized images

questions.explanation: All of the following activities should incorporate encryption, except for profile formatting, which is a made up term.

questions.question: The process of hardening a device should include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: We don't want to improve default accounts , we want to remove them. All the other options are steps we take to harden devices.

questions.question: The process of hardening a device should include which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Updating and patching the system helps harden the system. Encrypting the OS is a distractor. That would make the OS/machine impossible to use. Video cameras are a security control, but not one used to harden a device. Background checks are good for vetting personnel, but not for hardening devices.

questions.question: What is an experimental technology that is intended to create the possibility of processing encrypted data without having to decrypt it first?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Homomorphic encryption hopes to achieve that goal; the other options are terms that have almost nothing to do with encryption.

questions.question: Risk appetite for an organization is determined by which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation:
Senior management decides the risk appetite of the organization.
There is no such thing as reclusion evaluation.
Legislative mandates (laws) do not tell an organization which risks are acceptable except in very, very specific industries, and those are outliers.
Contracts don’t dictate acceptable risk for an organization; the organization should use its risk appetite to guide how it crafts contracts.

questions.question: What is the risk left over after controls and countermeasures are put in place?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: This is the definition of the term <italic>residual</italic>.

questions.question: All of the following are ways of addressing risk, except:
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Reversal is not a method for handling risk.

questions.question: To protect data on user devices in a Bring your own device (BYOD) environment, the organization should consider requiring all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Although all the other options are ways to harden a mobile device, two person integrity is a concept that has nothing to do with the topic, and, if implemented, would require everyone in your organization to walk around in pairs while using their mobile devices.

questions.question: Devices in the cloud datacenter should be secure against attack. All of the following are means of hardening devices, except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Although the rest of the options are good tactics for securing devices, we can't remove all admin accounts; the device will need to be administered at some point, and that account needs to be there.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes risk?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: The likelihood that a threat will exploit a vulnerability

questions.explanation: Option C is the definition of risk and risk is never preventable: it can be obviated, attenuated, reduced, and minimized, but never completely prevented. A risk may be everlasting or transient, indicating that risk itself is not limited to being either.

questions.question: All of the following are terms used to described the practice of obscuring original raw data so that only a portion is displayed for operational purposes, except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Data discovery is a term used to describe the process of identifying information according to specific traits or categories. The rest are all methods for obscuring data

questions.question: The goals of Security information and event Management (SIEM) solution implementation include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Security information and event Management (SIEM) does not intend to provide any enhancement of performance; in fact, a Security information and event Management (SIEM) solution may decrease performance because of additional overhead. All the rest are goals of Security information and event Management (SIEM) implementations.

questions.question: The goals of Data loss prevention (DLP) solution implementation include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Data loss prevention (DLP) does not have anything to do with elasticity, which is the capability of the environment to scale up or down according to demand. All the rest are goals of Data loss prevention (DLP) implementations.

questions.question: Data loss prevention (DLP) solutions can aid in deterring loss due to which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Data loss prevention (DLP) solutions may protect against inadvertent disclosure. Randomization is a technique for obscuring data, not a risk to data. Data loss prevention (DLP) tools will not protect against risks from natural disasters, or against impacts due to device failure.

questions.question: Data loss prevention (DLP) solutions can aid in deterring loss due to which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Data loss prevention (DLP) tools can identify outbound traffic that violates the organization's policies. Data loss prevention (DLP) will not protect against losses due to performance issues or power failures. The Data loss prevention (DLP) solution must be configured according to the organization's policies, so bad policies will attenuate the effectiveness of Data loss prevention (DLP) tools, not the other way around.

questions.question: What is the experimental technology that might lead to the possibility of processing encrypted data without having to decrypt it first?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) is an encryption standard. Link encryption is a method for protecting communications trafic. One time pads are an encryption method.

questions.question: Proper implementation of Data loss prevention (DLP) solutions for successful function requires which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Data loss prevention (DLP) tools need to be aware of which information to monitor and which requires categorization (usually done upon data creation, by the data owners). DLPs can be implemented with or without physical access or presence. USB connectivity has nothing to do with Data loss prevention (DLP) solutions.

questions.question: Tokenization requires two distinct.
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: In order to implement tokenization, there will need to be two databases: the database containing the raw, original data, and the token database containing tokens that map to original data. Having two factor authentication is nice, but certainly not required. Encryption keys are not necessary for tokenization. Two person integrity does not have anything to do with tokenization.

questions.question: Data masking can be used to provide all of the following functionality, except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Data masking does not support authentication in any way. All the others are excellent use cases for data masking.

questions.question: Data loss prevention (DLP) can be combined with what other security technology to enhance data controls?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Data loss prevention (DLP) can be combined with Digital rights management (DRM) to protect intellectual property; both are designed to deal with data that falls into special categories. Security information and event Management (SIEMs) are used for monitoring event logs, not live data movement. Kerberos is an authentication mechanism. Hypervisors are used for virtualization.

questions.question: What are the U.S. State Department controls on technology exports known as?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: International traffic in arms regulations (ITAR) is a Department of State program. Evaluation assurance level (EAL) are part of the Common Criteria standard from International Organization for Standardization (ISO). Digital rights management (DRM) tools are used for protecting electronic processing of intellectual property.

questions.question: What are the U.S. Commerce Department controls on technology exports known as?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Export administration regulations (EAR) is a Commerce Department program. International traffic in arms regulations (ITAR) is a Department of State program. Evaluation assurance level (EAL) are part of the Common Criteria standard from International Organization for Standardization (ISO). Digital rights management (DRM) tools are used for protecting electronic processing of intellectual property.

questions.question: Cryptographic keys for encrypted data stored in the cloud should be .
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security

choices.text: Not stored with the cloud provider

questions.explanation: Cryptographic keys should not be stored along with the data they secure, regardless of key length. We don't split crypto keys or generate redundant keys (doing so would violate the principle of secrecy necessary for keys to serve their purpose).

questions.question: Best practices for key management include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: We should do all of the following except for requiring multifactor authentication, which is pointless in key management.

questions.question: Cryptographic keys should be secured ______.
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security

choices.text: To a level at least as high as the data they can decrypt

questions.explanation: The physical security of crypto keys is of some concern, but guards or vaults are not always necessary. Two person integrity might be a good practice for protecting keys. The best answer to this question is option A, because it is always true, whereas the remaining options depend on circumstances.

questions.question: When crafting plans and policies for data archiving, we should consider all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: All of the following things should be considered when creating data archival policies, except option D, which is a nonsense term

questions.question: What is the correct order of the phases of the data life cycle?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security

choices.text: Create, Store, Use, Archive, Share, Destroy
Create, Store, Use, Share, Archive, Destroy
Create, Use, Store, Share, Archive, Destroy
Create, Archive, Store, Share, Use, Destroy

questions.explanation: The other options are the names of the phases, but out of proper order.

questions.question: What are third party providers of Identity and access management (IAM) functions for the cloud environment?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Data loss, leak prevention, and protection is a family of tools used to reduce the possibility of unauthorized disclosure of sensitive information. Security information and event Management (SIEMs) are tools used to collate and manage log data. Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) is an encryption standard.

questions.question: What is a cloud storage architecture that manages the data in a hierarchy of files?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Object based storage stores data as objects in a volume, with labels and metadata. Databases store data in fields, in a relational motif. A Content delivery network (CDN) stores data in caches of copied content near locations of high demand.

questions.question: What is a cloud storage architecture that manages the data in caches of copied content close to locations of high demand?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Object based storage stores data as objects in a volume, with labels and metadata. File based is a cloud storage architecture that manages the data in a hierarchy of files. Databases store data in fields, in a relational motif.

questions.question: What is the term we use to describe the general ease and efficiency of moving data from one cloud provider either to another cloud provider or down from the cloud?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Elasticity is the name for the benefit of cloud computing where resources can be apportioned as necessary to meet customer demand. Obfuscation is a technique to hide full raw datasets, either from personnel who do not have need to know or for use in testing. Mobility is not a term pertinent to the CBK.

questions.question: The various models generally available for cloud Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) activities include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Cloud provider, backup from same provider
Cloud provider, backup from another cloud provider
Cloud provider,  backup from private provider

questions.explanation: This is not a normal configuration and would not likely provide genuine benefit.

questions.question: Countermeasures for protecting cloud operations against external attackers include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: Hardened devices and systems, including servers, hosts, hypervisors, and virtual machines
Regular and detailed configuration/change management activities

questions.explanation: Background checks are controls for attenuating potential threats from internal actors; external threats aren't likely to submit to background checks.

questions.question: All of the following are techniques to enhance the portability of cloud data, in order to minimize the potential of vendor lock in except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Use Digital rights management (DRM) and Data loss prevention (DLP) solutions widely throughout the cloud operation
Ensure there are no physical limitations to moving
Ensure favorable contract terms to support portability

questions.explanation: Digital rights management (DRM) and Data loss prevention (DLP) are used for increased authentication/access control and egress monitoring, respectively, and would actually decrease portability instead of enhancing it.

questions.question: Which of the following is a technique used to attenuate risks to the cloud environment, resulting in loss or theft of a device used for remote access?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Dual control is not useful for remote access devices, because we'd have to assign two people for every device, which would decrease efficiency and productivity. Muddling is a cocktail preparation technique that involves crushing ingredients. Safe harbor is a policy provision that allows for compliance through an alternate method than the primary instruction.

questions.question: Each of the following are dependencies that must be considered when reviewing the Business impact analysis (BIA) after cloud migration except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The cloud provider's resellers are a marketing and sales mechanism, not an operational dependency that could affect the security of a cloud customer.

questions.question: When reviewing the Business impact analysis (BIA) after a cloud migration, the organization should take into account new factors related to data breach impacts. One of these new factors is:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Legal liability can't be transferred to the cloud provider.
Many states have data breach notification laws.
Breaches can cause the loss of proprietary data.
Breaches can cause the loss of intellectual property.

questions.explanation: State notification laws and the loss of proprietary data/intellectual property pre existed the cloud; only the lack of ability to transfer liability is new.

questions.question: The cloud customer will have the most control of their data and systems, and the cloud provider will have the least amount of responsibility, in which cloud computing arrangement?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) entails the cloud customer installing and maintaining the OS, programs, and data; Platform as a Service (PaaS) has the customer installing programs and data; in Software as a Service (SaaS), the customer only uploads data. In a community cloud, data and device owners are distributed.

questions.question: After a cloud migration, the Business impact analysis (BIA) should be updated to include a review of the new risks and impacts associated with cloud operations; this review should include an analysis of the possibility of vendor lock in/lock out. Analysis of this risk may not have to be performed as a new effort, because a lot of the material that would be included is already available from which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
The cost benefit analysis the organization conducted when deciding on cloud migration

questions.explanation: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) offers many informative guides and standards, but nothing specific to any one organization. The cloud provider will not have prepared an analysis of lock-out/lock-in potential. Open source providers can offer many useful materials, but, again, nothing specifc to the organization.

questions.question: A poorly negotiated cloud service contract could result in all of the following detrimental effects except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Malware risks and threats are not affected by the terms of the cloud contract.

questions.question: Because of multitenancy, specific risks in the public cloud that don't exist in the other cloud service models include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Risk of loss/disclosure due to legal seizures

questions.explanation: DoS/DDoS threats and risks are not unique to the public cloud model.

questions.question: Countermeasures for protecting cloud operations against internal threats include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Extensive and comprehensive training programs, including initial, recurring, and refresher sessions

questions.explanation: Hardened perimeter devices are more useful at attenuating the risk of external attack.

questions.question: Countermeasures for protecting cloud operations against internal threats include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Masking and obfuscation of data for all personnel without need to know for raw data

questions.explanation: ISP redundancy is a means to control the risk of externalities, not internal threats.

questions.question: Countermeasures for protecting cloud operations against internal threats include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Broad contractual protections to ensure the provider is ensuring an extreme level of trust in its own personnel
Financial penalties for the cloud provider in the event of negligence or malice on the part of its own personnel

questions.explanation: Scalability is a feature of cloud computing, allowing users to dictate an increase or decrease in service as needed, not a means to counter internal threats.

questions.question: Countermeasures for protecting cloud operations against internal threats include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Conflict of interest is a threat, not a control.

questions.question: Benefits for addressing Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) offered by cloud operations include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Distributed, remote processing, and storage of data
Regular backups offered by cloud providers

questions.explanation: Metered service allows cloud customers to minimize expenses, and only pay for what they need and use this has nothing to do with Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR).

questions.question: All of the following methods can be used to attenuate the harm caused by escalation of privilege except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Extensive access control and authentication tools and techniques
Analysis and review of all log data by trained, skilled personnel on a frequent basis
Periodic and effective use of cryptographic sanitization tools
The use of automated analysis tools such as Security information Management (SIM), Security information and event Management (SIEM), and Security event Management (SEM) solutions

questions.explanation: Cryptographic sanitization is a means of reducing the risks from data remnance, not a way to minimize escalation of privilege.

questions.question: What is the hypervisor malicious attackers would prefer to attack?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Attackers prefer Type 2 hypervisors, because the OS offers more attack surface and potential vulnerabilities. There are no Type 3 or 4 hypervisors.

questions.question: What is the term used to describe loss of access to data because the cloud provider has ceased operation?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Vendor lock-in is the result of a lack of portability, for any number of reasons. Masking is a means to hide raw datasets from users who do not have need to know. Closing is a nonsense term.

questions.question: Because Platform as a Service (PaaS) implementations are so often used for software development, what is one of the vulnerabilities that should always be kept in mind?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Software developers often install backdoors as a means to avoid performing entire work flows when adjusting the programs they're working; they often leave backdoors behind in production software, inadvertently or intentionally.

questions.question: What is the cloud service model in which the customer is responsible for administration of the OS?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: In Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), the cloud provider only owns the hardware and supplies the utilities. The customer is responsible for the OS, programs, and data. In Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Software as a Service (SaaS), the provider also owns the OS. There is no QaaS. That is a red herring.

questions.question: To address shared monitoring and testing responsibilities in a cloud configuration, the provider might offer all these to the cloud customer except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Access to audit logs and performance data

questions.explanation: While the provider might share any of the other options listed, the provider will not share administration of security controls with the customer. Security controls are the sole province of the provider.

questions.question: In addition to whatever audit results the provider shares with the customer, what other mechanism does the customer have to ensure trust in the provider's performance and duties?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)

questions.explanation: The contract between the provider and customer enhances the customer's trust by holding the provider financially liable for negligence or inadequate service (although the customer remains legally liable for all inadvertent disclosures). Statutes, however, largely leave customers liable. The security control matrix is a tool for ensuring compliance with regulations. Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) is a statute.

questions.question: Which kind of SSAE audit report is a cloud customer most likely to receive from a cloud provider?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The SOC 3 is the least detailed, so the provider is not concerned about revealing it. The SOC 1 Types 1 and 2 are about financial reporting, and not relevant. The SOC 2 Type 2 is much more detailed and will most likely be kept closely held by the provider.

questions.question: Which kind of SSAE audit report is most beneficial for a cloud customer, even though it's unlikely the cloud provider will share it?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The SOC 3 is the least detailed, so the provider is not concerned about revealing it. The SOC 1 Types 1 and 2 are about financial reporting and not relevant. The SOC 2 Type 2 is much more detailed and will most likely be kept closely held by the provider.

questions.question: The auditor should not  ___________________.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The auditor should be impartial to the success of the target organization; consulting creates a conflict of interest.

questions.question: Hardening the operating system refers to all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Removing antimalware agents. Hardening the operating system means making it more secure. Limiting administrator access, closing unused ports, and removing unnecessary services and libraries all have the potential to make an OS more secure. But removing anti malware agents would actually make the system less secure. If anything, antimalware agents should be added, not removed.

questions.question: The cloud customer's trust in the cloud provider can be enhanced by all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Video surveillance will not provide meaningful information and will not enhance trust. All the others will and do.

questions.question: User access to the cloud environment can be administered in all of the following ways except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Customer provides administration on behalf of the provider
Provider provides administration on behalf the customer
Third party provides administration on behalf of the customer

questions.explanation: The customer does not administer on behalf of the provider. All the rest are possible options.

questions.question: Which kind of SSAE audit reviews controls dealing with the organization's controls for assuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: SOC 2 deals with the CIA triad. SOC 1 is for financial reporting. SOC 3 is only an attestation by the auditor. There is no SOC 4.

questions.question: Which kind of SSAE report comes with a seal of approval from a certified auditor?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: SOC 2 deals with the CIA triad. SOC 1 is for financial reporting. SOC 3 is only an attestation by the auditor. There is no SOC 4.

questions.question: Which of the following is a cloud provider likely to provide to its customers in order to enhance the customer's trust in the provider?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The provider may share audit and performance log data with the customer. The provider will most likely not share any of the other options, since they reveal too much information about the provider's security program.

questions.question: In all cloud models, the customer will be given access and ability to modify which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The customer always owns the data and will therefore always have access to it. The customer will never have administrative access to the security controls, regardless of the model. The customer may or may not have administrative control over user permissions. The customer only has administrative power over the OS in an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) model.

questions.question: In all cloud models, security controls are driven by which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Security is always contingent on business drivers and beholden to operational needs. The virtualization engine does not dictate security controls, and the hypervisor may vary (depending on its type and implementation). The Service level agreements (SLAs) do not drive security controls; they drive performance goals.

questions.question: In all cloud models, the ________ will retain ultimate liability and responsibility for any data loss or disclosure.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The customer currently always retains legal liability for data loss, even if the provider was negligent or malicious.

questions.question: Why will cloud providers be unlikely to allow physical access to their datacenters?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: They want to enhance security by keeping information about physical layout and controls confidential.
They want to enhance exclusivity for their customers, so only an elite tier of higherpaying clientele will be allowed physical access.
They want to minimize traffic in those areas, to maximize efficiency of operational personnel.
Most datacenters are inhospitable to human life, so minimizing physical access also minimizes safety concerns.

questions.explanation: Knowledge of the physical layout and site controls could be of great use to an attacker, so they are kept extremely confidential. The other options are all red herrings.

questions.question: Which type of software is most likely to be reviewed by the most personnel, with the most varied perspectives?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Open source software is available to the public, and often draws inspection from numerous, disparate reviewers. A DBMS is not reviewed more or less than other software. All software in a production environment should be secure. That is not a valid discriminator for answering this question. Proprietary software reviews are limited to the personnel employed within the offices of the software developer, which narrows the perspective and necessarily reduces the amount of potential reviewers.

questions.question: A firewall can use all of the following techniques for controlling traffic except:
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Firewalls do use rules, behavior analytics, and/or content filtering in order to determine which traffic is allowable. Firewalls ought not use random criteria, because any such limitations would be just as likely to damage production efforts as enhance them.

questions.question: A honeypot should contain ______ data.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: A honeypot is meant to draw in attackers but not divulge anything of value. It should not use raw, production, or sensitive data.

questions.question: Vulnerability assessments cannot detect which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Vulnerability assessments can only detect known vulnerabilities, using definitions. Some malware is known, as are programming flaws. Zero-day exploits, on the other hand, are necessarily unknown, until discovered and exercised by an attacker, and will therefore not be detected by vulnerability assessments.

questions.question: Which of the following best represents the REST approach to APIs?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: The other answers all list aspects of SOAP.

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the SDLC phases?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: The other answers are all possible stages used in software development

questions.question: Which of the following is not a component of the of the STRIDE model?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: The other answers all include aspects of the STRIDE model.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes SAST?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: A set of technologies that analyze application source code, and bit code for coding and design problems that would indicate a security problem or vulnerability
A set of technologies that analyze application bit code, and binaries for coding and design problems that would indicate a security problem or vulnerability
A set of technologies that analyze application source code, byte code, and binaries for coding and design problems that would indicate a security problem or vulnerability
A set of technologies that analyze application source code for coding and design problems that would indicate a security problem or vulnerability

questions.explanation: All the possible answers are good, and are, in fact, correct. C, however, is the most complete and therefore the best answer.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes data masking?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: A method where the last few numbers in a dataset are not obscured. These are often used for authentication.
A method for creating similar but inauthentic datasets used for software testing and user training.
A method used to protect prying eyes from data such as social security numbers and credit card data.
Data masking involves stripping out all similar digits in a string of numbers so as to obscure the original number.

questions.explanation: Again, all of the following answers are actually correct, but B is the best answer, because it is the most general, includes the others, and is therefore the optimum choice. This is a good example of the type of question that can appear on the actual exam.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a sandbox?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: An isolated space where transactions are protected from malicious software
A space where you can safely execute malicious code to see what it does
An isolated space where untested code and experimentation can safely occur separate from the production environment
An isolated space where untested code and experimentation can safely occur within the production environment

questions.explanation: Options A and B are also correct, but C is more general and incorporates them both. D is incorrect, because sandboxing does not take place in the production environment.

questions.question: Identity and access management (IAM) is a security discipline that ensures which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: That all users are properly authorized
That the right individual gets access to the right resources at the right time for the right reasons
That all users are properly authenticated
That unauthorized users will get access to the right resources at the right time for the right reasons

questions.explanation: Options A and C are also correct, but included in B, making B the best choice. D is incorrect, because we don't want unauthorized users gaining access.

questions.question: In a federated identity arrangement using a trusted third party model, who is the identity provider and who is the relying party?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: A contracted third party/the various member organizations of the federation
The users of the various organizations within the federation/a CASB
Each member organization/a trusted third party

questions.explanation: In a trusted third-party model of federation, each member organization outsources the review and approval task to a third party they all trust. This makes the third party the identifer (it issues and manages identities for all users in all organizations in the federation), and the various member organizations are the relying parties (the resource providers that share resources based on approval from the third party).

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the Organizational Normative Framework (ONF)?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: A container for components of an application's security, best practices, catalogued and leveraged by the organization
A framework of containers for all components of application security, best practices, catalogued and leveraged by the organization
A set of application security, and best practices, catalogued and leveraged by the organization
A framework of containers for some of the components of application security, best practices, catalogued and leveraged by the organization

questions.explanation: Option A is incorrect, because it refers to a specific applications security elements, meaning it is about an Application normative framework (ANF), not the Organizational Normative Framework (ONF). C is true, but not as complete as B, making B the better choice. D suggests that the framework contains only "some" of the components, which is why B (which describes "all" components) is better.

questions.question: APIs are defined as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: A set of protocols, and tools for building software applications to access a web based software application or tool
A set of standards for building software applications to access a web based software application or tool
A set of routines, standards, protocols, and tools for building software applications to access a web based software application or tool
A set of routines and tools for building software applications to access web based software applications

questions.explanation: All the answers are true, but C is the most complete.

questions.question: The application normative framework is best described as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: A stand alone framework for storing security practices for the Organizational Normative Framework (ONF)
A subset of the Organizational Normative Framework (ONF)
A superset of the Organizational Normative Framework (ONF)

questions.explanation: Remember, there is a one-to-many ratio of Organizational Normative Framework (ONF) to Application normative framework (ANF); each organization has one Organizational Normative Framework (ONF) and many ANFs (one for each application in the organization). Therefore, the Application normative framework (ANF) is a subset of the Organizational Normative Framework (ONF).

questions.question: Which of the following best describes SAML?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: A standard for developing secure application management logistics
A standard for exchanging authentication and authorization data between security domains
A standard for exchanging usernames and passwords across devices
A standard used for directory synchronization

questions.explanation: Option C is also true, but not as comprehensive as B. A and D are simply not true.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the purpose and scope of International Organization for Standardization (ISO)/International electrotechnical commission (IEC) 27034 1?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: Describes international privacy standards for cloud computing
Provides an overview of application security that introduces definitive concepts, principles, and processes involved in application security
Serves as a newer replacement for National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800 53 r4
Provides an overview of network and infrastructure security designed to secure cloud applications

questions.explanation: Option B is a description of the standard; the others are not.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes data masking?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: Data masking is used in place of encryption for better performance.
Data masking is used to hide Personally identifiable information (PII).
Data masking is used to create a similar, inauthentic dataset used for training and software testing.
Data masking is used in place of production data.

questions.explanation: Options B and D are also correct, but not as comprehensive as C, making C the best choice. A is not correct; we don't want to encrypt data if we're using the data for testing or display purposes, the common uses of masked data.

questions.question: Database activity monitoring (DAM) can be:
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: Used in the place of encryption
Used in place of data masking

questions.explanation: We don't use DAM in place of encryption or masking; DAM augments these options without replacing them. “Reactive or imperative” has no meaning in this context, and is only a distractor.

questions.question: WAFs operate at OSI Layer ___________________.
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: WAFs operate at Layer 7 of the OSI model.

questions.question: Multifactor authentication consists of at least two items. Which of the following best represents this concept?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: A complex password and a secret code
A hardware token and a magnetic strip card
Something you know and something you have

questions.explanation: Option D is the best, most general, and most accurate answer.

questions.question: SOAP is a protocol specification providing for the exchange of structured information or data in web services. Which of the following is not true of SOAP?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: The other answers are true of SOAP.

questions.question: Dynamic application security testing (DAST) is best described as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: Test performed on an application or software product while it is using real data in production
Test performed on an application or software product while it is being executed in memory in an operating system.
Test performed on an application or software product while being consumed by cloud customers

questions.explanation: We do the testing prior to deployment, so A and C are incorrect. D is simply a distractor.

questions.question: Sandboxing provides which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: A test environment that isolates untrusted code changes for testing in a production environment
A test environment that isolates untrusted code changes for testing in a nonproduction environment
A testing environment where new and experimental code can be tested in a production environment
A testing environment that prevents isolated code from running in a nonproduction environment

questions.explanation: Options A and C are incorrect, because a sandbox is not in the production environment. D is incorrect in that sandboxing does not prevent code from running.

questions.question: What is the lowest tier of datacenter redundancy, according to the Uptime Institute?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: There are four tiers of the Uptime Institute's datacenter redundancy rating system, with 1 being the lowest and 4 the highest.

questions.question: What is the amount of fuel that should be on hand to power generators for backup datacenter power, in all tiers, according to the Uptime Institute?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: As much as needed to ensure all systems may be gracefully shut down and data securely stored

questions.explanation: The other answers are distractors.

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the three types of training?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: The three common types of security training are initial, recurring, and refresher.

questions.question: Which of the following is part of the STRIDE model?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Repudiation is an element of the STRIDE model; the rest of the answers are not.

questions.question: Which of the following is not part of the STRIDE model?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Resiliency is not an element of the STRIDE model; all the rest of the answers are.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a feature of SAST?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: Highly skilled, often expensive outside consultants

questions.explanation: Team building has nothing to do with SAST; all the rest of the answers are characteristics of SAST.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a feature of DAST?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Binary inspection has nothing to do with DAST, and it is not really a term that means anything in our industry (although it could be interpreted as a type of code review, more related to SAST); all the rest of the answers are characteristics of DAST.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a feature of a secure KVM component?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Keystroke logging is not a characteristic of secure KVM design; in fact, secure KVM components should attenuate the potential for keystroke logging. All the rest of the answers are characteristics of secure KVM components.

questions.question: What type of redundancy can we expect to find in a datacenter of any tier?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Emergency egress redundancy is the only aspect of datacenters that can be expected to be found in datacenters of any tier; the rest of the answers list characteristics that can be found only in specific tiers.

questions.question: What should be the primary focus of datacenter redundancy and contingency planning?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Regardless of the tier level or purpose of any datacenter, design focus for security should always consider health and human safety paramount.

questions.question: Which of the following techniques for ensuring cloud datacenter storage resiliency uses parity bits and disk striping?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Parity bits and disk striping are characteristic of RAID implementations. Cloud bursting is a feature of scalable cloud hosting. Data dispersion uses parity bits, but not disk striping; instead, it uses data chunks and encryption. SAN is a data storage technique, but not focused on resiliency.

questions.question: Which resiliency technique attenuates the possible loss of functional capabilities during contingency operations?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations

choices.text: Proper placement of HVAC temperature measurements tools

questions.explanation: Cross-training offers attenuation of lost contingency capabilities by ensuring personnel will be able to perform essential tasks, even if they are not primarily assigned to those positions in a full-time capacity. Metered usage is a benefit for cloud customers associated with ensuring value for payment, but not resiliency. Proper placement of HVAC temperature measurement and raised floors both aid in optimizing component performance but are not practically associated with resiliency. This is a difficult question, and it could be read in ways that would suggest other correct answers.

questions.question: Which of the following has not been attributed as the cause of lost capabilities due to DoS?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Changing regulations should not result in lack of availability. All the other answers have caused DoS outages.

questions.question: If a hospital is considering using a cloud data center, which Uptime Institute Tier should it require?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Tier 4 is the highest in the Uptime Institute standard; it is the only suitable tier for life-critical systems. Tier 2 does not provide sufficient redundancy/resiliency for supporting medical services. There are no Tiers 8 or X. As a test-taking tip, it helps to assume all the hospital's systems will migrate to the cloud unless otherwise stated. There could arguably be hospital systems that are not life-critical which wouldn't require Tier 4, but since that detail is not in the question, the broadest reading is appropriate.

questions.question: What is often a major challenge to getting both redundant power and communications utility connections?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: The location of many datacenters - rurally situated, distant from metropolitan areas - may create challenges for finding multiple power utility providers and ISPs, as those areas just aren't usually served by multiple vendors. Expense is not usually a concern; economies of scale make costs acceptable as part of the pricing structure. Personnel deployment doesn't usually affect access to either type of connection. The carrying medium has nothing to do with challenges for finding multiple providers and is not even a common industry term.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an aspect of physical security that ought to be considered in the planning and design of a cloud datacenter facility?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: The height of dropped ceilings is not a security concern, except in action movies. The rest of the answers are all aspects of physical security that should be taken into account when planning and designing a datacenter.

questions.question: The Brewer Nash security model is also known as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: The Brewer-Nash model is also known as the Chinese Wall model.

questions.question: Which kind of hypervisor would malicious actors prefer to attack, ostensibly because it offers a greater attack surface?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Type II hypervisors run via the OS on the host machine; this makes them attractive to attackers, as both the machine and the OS offer potential attack vectors. Cat IV and converged are not terms associated with hypervisors. Bare-metal hypervisors (Type I) are less preferable to attackers, as they offer less attack surface.

questions.question: Which of the following techniques for ensuring cloud datacenter storage resiliency uses encrypted chunks of data?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Data dispersion uses parity bits, data chunks, and encryption. Parity bits and disk striping are characteristic of RAID implementations. Cloud-bursting is a feature of scalable cloud hosting. SAN is a data storage technique but not focused on resiliency.

questions.question: Which of the following data center redundancy efforts probably poses the greatest threat to human safety?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Generators require fuel, and fuel is flammable. All the other answers do not represent an appreciable threat to human safety.

questions.question: Which form of Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) testing has the most impact on operations?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: The full test will involve every asset in the organization, including all personnel. The others will have lesser impact, except for D, which is a red herring.

questions.question: Which form of Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) testing has the least impact on operations?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: The tabletop testing involves only essential personnel and none of the production assets. The others will have greater impact, except for D, which is a red herring.

questions.question: Which characteristic of liquid propane increases its desirability as a fuel for backup generators?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Liquid propane does not spoil, which obviates necessity for continually refreshing and restocking it and might make it more cost-effective. The burn rate has nothing to do with its suitability, unless it has some direct bearing on the particular generator the datacenter owner has chosen. The various relative prices of fuel fluctuate. Flavor is a distractor in this question and means nothing.

questions.question: How often should the CMB meet?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations

choices.text: Often enough to address organizational needs and attenuate frustration with delay

questions.explanation: Frustrated employees and managers can increase risk to the organization by implementing their own, unapproved modifcations to the environment. The particular interval changes from organization to organization.

questions.question: Adhering to ASHRAE standards for humidity can reduce the possibility of __________.
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: A datacenter with less than optimum humidity can have a higher static electricity discharge rate. Humidity has no bearing on breaches or theft, and inversion is a nonsense term used as a distractor.

questions.question: A UPS should have enough power to last how long?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: The UPS is intended to last only long enough to save production data currently being processed. The exact quantity of time will depend on many variables and will differ from one datacenter to the next.

questions.question: A generator transfer switch should bring backup power online within what time frame?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: Before the recovery point objective is reached
Before the UPS duration is exceeded

questions.explanation: Generator power should be online before battery backups fail. The specic amount of time will vary between datacenters.

questions.question: Which characteristic of automated patching makes it attractive?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Automated patching is much faster and more efficient than manual patching. It is, however, not necessarily any less expensive than manual patching. Manual patching is overseen by administrators, who will recognize problems faster than automated tools. Noise reduction is not a factor in patch management at all.

questions.question: Which tool can reduce confusion and misunderstanding during a Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) response?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Checklists serve as a reliable guide for Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) activity and should be straightforward enough to use that someone not already an expert or trained in Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) response could ostensibly accomplish the necessary tasks. Flashlights and call trees are certainly useful during Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) actions, but not for the purpose of reducing confusion and misunderstanding. Control matrices are not useful during Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) actions.

questions.question: When deciding whether to apply specific updates, it is best to follow , in order to demonstrate due care.
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: A datacenter that doesn't follow vendor guidance might be seen as failing to provide due care. Regulations, internal policy, and the actions of competitors might all inform the decision to perform an update and patch, but these are not necessarily directly bearing on due care. This is a difficult, nuanced question, and all the answers are good, but option B is the best.

questions.question: The CMB should include representations from all of the following offices except:
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Regulators are not involved in an organization's CMB; all the rest are.

questions.question: For performance purposes, OS monitoring should include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Print spooling is not a metric for system performance; all the rest are.

questions.question: Maintenance mode requires all of the following actions except:
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: While the other answers are all steps in moving from normal operations to maintenance mode, we do not necessarily initiate any enhanced security controls.

questions.question: What is one of the reasons a baseline might be changed?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: If the CMB is receiving numerous change requests to the point where the amount of requests would drop by modifying the baseline, then that is a good reason to change the baseline. None of the other reasons should involve the baseline at all.

questions.question: In addition to battery backup, a UPS can offer which capability?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: A UPS can provide line conditioning, adjusting power so that it is optimized for the devices it serves and smoothing any power fluctuations; it does not offer any of the other listed functions.

questions.question: Deviations from the baseline should be investigated and ______.
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: All deviations from the baseline should be documented, including details of the investigation and outcome. We do not enforce or encourage deviations. Presumably, we would already be aware of the deviation, so "revealing" is not a reasonable answer.

questions.question: The baseline should cover which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations

choices.text: As many systems throughout the organization as possible

questions.explanation: The more systems that be included in the baseline, the more cost-effective and scalable the baseline is. The baseline does not deal with breaches or version control; those are the provinces of the security office and CMB, respectively. Regulatory compliance might (and usually will) go beyond the baseline and involve systems, processes, and personnel that are not subject to the baseline.

questions.question: A localized incident or disaster can be addressed in a cost effective manner by using which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Joint operating agreements can provide nearby relocation sites so that a disruption limited to the organization's own facility and campus can be addressed at a different facility and campus. UPS and generators are not limited to serving needs for localized causes. Regulations do not promote cost savings and are not often the immediate concern during Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) activities.

questions.question: Generator fuel storage for a cloud datacenter should last for how long, at a minimum?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: The Uptime Institute dictates 12 hours of generator fuel for all cloud datacenter tiers.

questions.question: The Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) kit should include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: While hard drives may be useful in the kit (for instance, if they store Business Continuity (BC) / Disaster Recovery (DR) data such as inventory lists, baselines, and patches), they are not necessarily required. All the other items should be included.

questions.question: Which of the following is the least challenging with regard to eDiscovery in the cloud?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Identifying roles such as data owner, controller, and processor

questions.explanation: Forensic analysis is the least challenging of the answers provided as it refers to the analysis of data once it is obtained. The challenges revolve around obtaining the data for analysis due to the complexities of international law, the decentralization of data storage or difficulty knowing where to look, and identifying the data owner, controller, and processor.

questions.question: Legal controls refer to which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Controls designed to comply with laws and regulations related to the cloud environment
Payment card industry (PCI) Data security standard (DSS)
National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800 53r4

questions.explanation: Legal controls are those controls that are designed to comply with laws and regulations whether they be local or international.

questions.question: Which of the following terms is not associated with cloud forensics?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Plausibility, here, is a distractor and not specifically relevant to cloud forensics.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a component of contractual Personally identifiable information (PII)?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The value of data itself has nothing to do with it being considered a part of contractual Personally identifiable information (PII) even though it may have value associated with it.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best example of a key component of regulated Personally identifiable information (PII)?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Payment card industry (PCI) Data security standard (DSS)

questions.explanation: Mandatory breach reporting is the best example of regulated Personally identifiable information (PII) components. The rest are generally considered components of contractual Personally identifiable information (PII).

questions.question: Which of the following is not associated with security?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Quality is not associated with security in the way that confidentiality, integrity, and availability are.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best advantage of external audits?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The primary advantage of external audits based on the choices given would be that of independence. External audits are typically more independent and therefore lead to more effective results.

questions.question: Which of the following laws resulted from a lack of independence in audit practices?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)

questions.explanation: Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) was passed primarily to address the issues of audit independence, poor board over sight, and transparency of findings.

questions.question: Which of the following reports is no longer used?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The SAS 70 was a report used in the past primarily for financial reporting and was oftentimes misused in the service provider context. The SSAE 16 standards and subsequent SOC reports are its successors.

questions.question: Which of the following report is most aligned with financial control audits?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The SOC 1 report focuses primarily on controls associated with financial services. While IT controls are certainly part of most accounting systems today, the focus is on the controls around those financial systems

questions.question: Which of the following is the primary purpose of an SOC 3 report?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
