choices.text: Compliance with Payment card industry (PCI) / Data security standard (DSS)
Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) compliance

questions.explanation: The SOC 3 report is more of an attestation than a full evaluation of controls associated with a service provider.

questions.question: Which of the following is the primary purpose of an SOC 3 report?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The SOC 3 report is more of an attestation than a full evaluation of controls associated with a service provider.

questions.question: GAAPs are created and maintained by which organization?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: International Organization for Standardization (ISO)/International electrotechnical commission (IEC)
American institute of certified public accountants (AICPA)

questions.explanation: The American institute of certified public accountants (AICPA) is the organization responsible for generating and maintaining what are the Generally Accepted Accounting Practices in the United States.

questions.question: Which statute addresses security and privacy matters in the financial industry?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Family educational rights and privacy act (FERPA)
Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)

questions.explanation: Family educational rights and privacy act (FERPA) deals with data protection in the academic industry, Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) in the medical industry, and Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) for publicly traded corporations.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an example of a highly regulated environment?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Wholesalers or distributors are generally not regulated, although the products they sell may be.

questions.question: Which of the following SOC report subtypes represents a point in time?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: An SOC Type I report is designed around a specific point in time as opposed to a report of effectiveness over a period of time.

questions.question: Which of the following SOC report subtypes spans a period of time?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: An SOC Type II report is designed around a period of time as opposed to a specific point in time.

questions.question: The right to be forgotten refers to which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: The right to no longer pay taxes
The right to have all of a data owner's data erased

questions.explanation: The right to be forgotten is about the individual's right to have data removed from a provider at any time per their request. It is being tried in the EU at the moment but does not yet apply here in the United States.

questions.question: The right to audit should be a part of what documents?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The right to audit should be contained in the client Service level agreement (SLA).

questions.question: Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) was enacted because of which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Options A, B, and C are reasons leading up to the creation and passage of Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) .

questions.question: What is a key component of Gramm Leach Bliley Act (GLBA)?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The most important aspect of Gramm Leach Bliley Act (GLBA) was the creation of a formal information security program.

questions.question: Which of the following are not associated with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) controls?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Financial controls are not addressed by Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).

questions.question: What does the doctrine of the proper law refer to?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: The law that is applied after the first law is applied
The determination of what law will apply to a case
The proper handling of eDiscovery materials

questions.explanation: The doctrine of the proper law refers to how jurisdictional disputes are settled.

questions.question: The Restatement (Second) Conflict of Law refers to which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: The basis for deciding which laws are most appropriate in a situation where conflicting laws exist
When judges restate the law in an opinion
Whether local or federal laws apply in a situation

questions.explanation: The Restatement (Second) Conflict of Law is the basis used for determining which laws are most appropriate in a situation where conflicting laws exist.

questions.question: Which of the following applies to the Stored Communications Act (SCA)?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: It's in bad need of updating.
It's unclear with regard to current technologies.

questions.explanation: The Stored Communication Act, passed in 1995, is old, in bad need of updating, and unclear with regard to newer technologies.

questions.question: Which is the lowest level of the CSA STAR program?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The lowest level is Level 1, which is self-assessment, Level 2 is an external third-party attestation, and Level 3 is a continuous-monitoring program. Hybridization does not exist as part of the CSA STAR program.

questions.question: Which of the following is a valid risk management metric?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: KRI stands for key risk indicator. KRIs are the red flags if you will in the world of risk management. When these change, they indicate something is amiss and should be looked at quickly to determine if the change is minor or indicative of something important.

questions.question: Which of the following frameworks focuses specifically on design implementation and management?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)
National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-92

questions.explanation: International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 31000:2009 specifically focuses on design implementation and management. Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) refers to health care regulations, National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-92 is about log management, and International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 27017 is about cloud specific security controls.

questions.question: Which of the following frameworks identifies the top 8 security risks based on likelihood and impact?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-53
European Union Agency for Network and Information Security (ENISA)
Control objectives for information and related technologies (COBIT)

questions.explanation: European Union Agency for Network and Information Security (ENISA) specifically identifies the top 8 security risks based on likelihood and impact.

questions.question: The CSA STAR program consists of three levels. Which of the following is not one of those levels?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The SOC 2 report is not a part of the CSA Star program. It is a totally different audit reporting standard developed by the American institute of certified public accountants (AICPA).

questions.question: Which International Organization for Standardization (ISO) standard refers to addressing security risks in a supply chain?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: International Organization for Standardization (ISO)/International electrotechnical commission (IEC) 28000:2007

questions.explanation: International Organization for Standardization (ISO) /International electrotechnical commission (IEC) 28000-2007 applies to security controls in supply chains. The others are cloud computing standards by have little to do with supply chain management.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a risk management framework?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) SP 800-37
European Union Agency for Network and Information Security (ENISA)

questions.explanation: Key risk indicators are useful, but they are not a framework. International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 31000:2009 is an international standard that focuses on designing, implementing, and reviewing risk management processes and practices. National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) SP 800-37 is the Guide for Implementing the Risk Management Framework (RMF), a methodology for handling all organizational risk in a holistic, comprehensive, and continual manner. European Union Agency for Network and Information Security (ENISA) identifies 35 types of risks organizations should consider but goes further by identifying the top eight security risks based on likelihood and impact.

questions.question: Which of the following best define risk?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Threat coupled with a threat actor

questions.explanation: The best definition of risk is that of a threat coupled with a vulnerability.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a part of the European Union Agency for Network and Information Security (ENISA) Top 8 Security Risks of cloud computing?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The European Union Agency for Network and Information Security (ENISA) Top 8 Security Risks of Cloud Computing does not include availability, even though it is certainly a risk that could be realized.

questions.question: Which of the following is a risk management option that halts a business function?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Avoidance halts the business process, mitigation entails using controls to reduce risk, acceptance involves taking on the risk, and transference usually involves insurance.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a cloud carrier?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: A person or entity responsible for making a cloud service available to consumers
The intermediary who provides connectivity and transport of cloud services between cloud providers and cloud consumers
The person or entity responsible for keeping cloud services running for customers
The person or entity responsible for transporting data across the Internet

questions.explanation: A cloud carrier is the intermediary who provides connectivity and transport of cloud services between cloud providers and cloud customers.

questions.question: Which of the following methods of addressing risk is most associated with insurance?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Avoidance halts the business process, mitigation entails using controls to reduce risk, acceptance involves taking on the risk, and transference usually involves insurance.

questions.question: Which of the following components are part of what a CCSP should review when looking at contracting with a cloud service provider?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: The physical layout of the datacenter
Background checks for the provider's personnel

questions.explanation: The use of subcontractors can add risk to the supply chain and should be considered; trusting the provider's management of their vendors and suppliers (including subcontractors) is important to trusting the provider. Conversely, the customer is not likely to be allowed to review the physical design of the datacenter (or, indeed, even know the exact location of the datacenter) or the personnel security specifics for the provider's staff. "Redundant uplink grafts" is a nonsense term used as a distractor.

questions.question: The difference between KPIs and a KRIs is which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: KPIs no longer exist, having been replaced by KRIs.
KRIs no longer exist, having been replaced by KPIs.
KRIs are forward looking, while KPIs are backward looking.
There is no difference between KPIs and KRIs.

questions.explanation: Key risk indicators (KRIs) try to predict future risk, while key performance indicators (KPIs) examine events that have already happened. The other answers are just distractors.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a way to manage risk?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Enveloping is a nonsense term, unrelated to risk management. The rest are not.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a risk management framework?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Control objectives for information and related technologies (COBIT)
National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) SP 800-37

questions.explanation: Hex GBL is a reference to a computer part in Terry Pratchett's fictional Discworld universe. The rest are not.

questions.question: Which of the following is not appropriate to include in an Service level agreement (SLA)?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: The number of user accounts allowed during a specified period
Which personnel are responsible and authorized among both the provider and the customer to declare an emergency and transition the service to contingency operation status
The amount of data allowed to be transmitted and received between the cloud provider and customer
The time allowed to migrate from normal operations to contingency operations

questions.explanation: Roles and responsibilities should be included in the contract, not the Service level agreement (SLA); a good method to determine whether something might belong in the Service level agreement (SLA) at all is figuring out whether a numerical value is associated with it - in this case, the element involves names and offices (roles), not numerical values, so it's immediately recognizable as something that isn't appropriate for the Service level agreement (SLA). Options A and C are explicitly defined by exact numbers and are just the sort of aspects that belong in the Service level agreement (SLA). Option D, the amount of time allowed to transition between normal and contingency operations, is also an explicit numerical value, but it is not a recurring event, regularly anticipated during each period of performance (or shouldn't be, anyway; if your cloud provider is fluctuating between normal and contingency ops every performance period, you should probably find a new provider), so this is something that can be defined once in the contract, and if the provider fails to perform in the (hopefully rare) event it needs to be evaluated, then the provider is in breach, and there should be remedies available other than the Service level agreement (SLA). This is not an easy question, and understanding the nuances can be difficult.

questions.question: What is the Cloud Security Alliance Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM)?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: An inventory of cloud service security controls that are arranged into separate security domains
An inventory of cloud services security controls that are arranged into a hierarchy of security domains
A set of regulatory requirements for cloud service providers
A set of software development life cycle requirements for cloud service providers

questions.explanation: The CSA CCM is an inventory of cloud service security controls that are arranged into separate security domains, not a hierarchy.

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the types of controls?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Transitional is not a term we associate with types of controls; the rest are.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an example of an essential internal stakeholder?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: An IT analyst is generally not high enough of a position to be able to provide quality information to other stakeholders. However, the IT director would be in such a positon, as would the others.

questions.question: What type of solutions enable enterprises or individuals to store their data and computer files on the Internet using a storage service provider rather than storing the data locally on a physical disk, such as a hard drive or tape backup?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Cloud backup solutions enable enterprises to store their data and computer files on the Internet using a storage service rather than storing data locally on a hard disk or tape backup. This has the added benefit of providing access to data should the primary business location be damaged in some way that prevents accessing or restoring data locally due to damaged infrastructure or equipment. Online backups and removable hard drives are other options but do not by default supply the customer with ubiquitous access. Masking is a technology used to partially conceal sensitive data.

questions.question: When using an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) solution, what is the key benefit for the customer?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The primary benefit to the customer of using Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) is the transfer of cost of ownership. In a cloud environment, the customer uses and is billed only for what they use as opposed to the full cost of implementation, saving them a significant amount in terms of cost of ownership. While scalability, metered service, and energy and cooling efficiencies are a part of the benefit of a cloud computing environment, they are not the primary benefit or business driver behind Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) adoption.

questions.question: ______ focuses on security and encryption to prevent unauthorized copying and limitations on distribution to only those who pay.
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Digital rights management (DRM) was designed to focus on security and encryption as a means of preventing unauthorized copying and limitations on distribution of content to only those authorized (purchasers). Enterprise digital rights management, also known as Information rights management (IRM), is a subset of Digital rights management (DRM) and typically refers to business to business securing of information rights. Bit splitting is a method of hiding information across multiple geographical boundaries, and degaussing is a method of deleting data permanently from magnetic media.

questions.question: Which of the following represents the correct set of four cloud deployment models?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The only correct answer for this is Public, Private, Hybrid, and Community. Joint, Internet, and External are not cloud models.

questions.question: What is a special mathematical code that allows encryption hardware/software to encode and then decipher an encrypted message called?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: An encryption key is just that: a key used to encrypt and decrypt information. It is mathematical code that supports either hardware or software based encryption used to encode or decode information.

questions.question: Which of the following lists the correct six components of the STRIDE threat model?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: Spoofing, Tampering, Repudiation, Information Disclosure, Denial of Service, and Elevation of Privilege
Spoofing, Tampering, Repudiation, Information Disclosure, Denial of Service, and Social Engineering Elasticity
Spoofing, Tampering, Repudiation, Information Disclosure, Distributed Denial of Service, and Elevation of Privilege
Spoofing, Tampering, Nonrepudiation, Information Disclosure, Denial of Service, and Elevation of Privilege

questions.explanation: The letters in STRIDE threat model represent Spoofing of identity, Tampering with data, Repudiation, Information disclosure, Denial of service, and Elevation of privilege. The other options are simply mixed up or incorrect versions of the same.

questions.question: What is the term for the assurance that a specific author actually created and sent a specific item to a specific recipient, and that the message was successfully received?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Nonrepudiation means that a specific author or user cannot refute or repudiate that he or she created and/or sent a message and the receiver of the data or message cannot deny they received it.

questions.question: What is the correct term for the process of deliberately destroying the encryption keys used to encrypt data?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The act of crypto shredding means destroying the key that was initially used to encrypt the data, thereby making it forever unrecoverable.

questions.question: In a federated environment, who is the relying party, and what do they do?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: The relying party is the service provider and they would consume the tokens generated by the identity provider.
The relying party is the service provider and they would consume the tokens generated by the customer.
The relying party is the customer and they would consume the tokens generated by the identity provider.
The relying party is the identity provider and they would consume the tokens generated by the service provider.

questions.explanation: The identity provider would hold all of the identities and generate a token for known users. The relying party (RP) would be the service provider and would consume the tokens. All other answers are incorrect.

questions.question: What is the process of replacing sensitive data with unique identification symbols that retain all the essential information about the data without compromising its security?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Replacing sensitive data with unique identification symbols is known as tokenization, a simple and only somewhat effective way of hiding or concealing sensitive data with the replacement of unique identification symbols. It is not considered as strong as encryption but can be effective in keeping prying eyes off of sensitive information. While randomization and obfuscation are also means of concealing information, they are done quite differently.

questions.question: Which of the following data storage types are associated or used with Platform as a Service (PaaS)?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Platform as a Service (PaaS) uses databases and Big Data storage types.

questions.question: What is the term used for software technology that encapsulates application software from the underlying operating system on which it is executed?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Application virtualization encapsulates application software from the underlying operating system on which it is executed.

questions.question: Which of the following represents the legislation enacted to protect shareholders and the public from enterprise accounting errors and fraudulent practices?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA)

questions.explanation: The Sarbanes Oxley Act (SOX) was enacted in response to the 2000 accounting scandal that caused the bankruptcy of Enron. At that time, top executives laid the claim that they were unaware of the accounting practices that led to the company's demise. Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) not only forces executives to oversee all accounting practices, but holds them accountable should such activity occur again.

questions.question: What is a device called that can safely store and manage encryption keys and is used in servers, data transmission, and log files?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: A hardware security module is a device that can safely store and manage encryption keys. These can be used in servers, workstations, and so on. Once common type is called the Trusted Platform Module (TPM) and can be found on enterprise workstations and laptops. There is no such term as a trusted operating system, and public and private keys are terms used with Public key infrastructure (PKI).

questions.question: What is a type of cloud infrastructure that is provisioned for open use by the general public and is owned, managed, and operated by a business, academic, or government organization and exists on the premises of the cloud provider called?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: This is the very definition of public cloud computing.

questions.question: When using transparent encryption of a database, where does the encryption engine reside?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security

choices.text: At the application using the database
On the instances attached to the volume

questions.explanation: In transparent encryption, the encryption key for a database is stored in the boot record of the database itself.

questions.question: What is a type of assessment called that employs a set of methods, principles, or rules for assessing risk based on non numerical categories or levels?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: A qualitative assessment is a set of methods or rules for assessing risk based on non mathematical or categories or levels. One that uses those mathematical categories or levels is called a quantitative assessment. There is no such thing as a hybrid assessment, and an SOC 2 is an accounting report regarding control effectiveness.

questions.question: What best describes the Cloud Security Alliance Cloud Controls Matrix ?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations

choices.text: A set of regulatory requirements for cloud service providers
A set of software development life cycle requirements for cloud service providers

A security controls framework that provides mapping/cross relationships with the main industry accepted security standards, regulations, and controls frameworks such as the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 27001 27002, ISACA's Control objectives for information and related technologies (COBIT), and Payment card industry (PCI) Data security standard (DSS)
An inventory of cloud service security controls that are arranged into separate security domains

questions.explanation: The CCM cross references many industry standards, laws, and guidelines.

questions.question: When a conflict of laws occurs, determines the jurisdiction in which the dispute will be heard.
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The Doctrine of Proper Law is used when a dispute occurs over which jurisdiction will hear a case. Tort law refers to civil liability suits. Common law refers to laws regarding marriage, and criminal law refers to violations of state or federal criminal code.

questions.question: Which one of the following is the most important security consideration when selecting a new computer facility?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Of the answers given, option D is the most important. It is vital that any datacenter facility be close to sound facility resources such as power, water, and connectivity.

questions.question: Which of the following is always safe to use in the disposal of electronic records within a cloud environment?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Encryption can always be used in a cloud environment, but physical destruction, over writing, and degaussing may not be available due to access and physical separation factors.

questions.question: Which of the following describes a SYN flood attack?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: Rapid transmission of Internet Relay Chat (IRC) messages
Creating a high number of partially open TCP connections
Disabling the Domain Name Service (DNS) server
Excessive list linking of users and files

questions.explanation: A SYN flood is where a TCP connection attempt is made and then cut short just prior to completion, thereby leaving a server waiting for a response. If enough of these connection attempts are made, a "flood" occurs, causing the end unit to consume resources to the point that either services and/or the system itself become unavailable for use. The other options have no connection with a flood of any kind.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a form of cloud storage that applies to storing an individual's mobile device data in the cloud and providing the individual with access to the data from anywhere?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Mobile cloud storage is defined as a form of cloud storage that applies to storing an individual's mobile device data in the cloud and providing the individual with access to the data from anywhere.

questions.question: Which of the following terms best describes a distributed model where software applications are hosted by a vendor or cloud service provider and made available to customers over network resources?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: This is the definition of the Software as a Service (SaaS) service model. Public and private are cloud deployment models, and Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) does not provide applications of any type.

questions.question: Which of the following is a federal law enacted in the United States to control the way that financial institutions deal with private information of individuals?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: International Organization for Standardization (ISO)/International electrotechnical commission (IEC)

questions.explanation: The Gramm Leach Bliley Act targets U.S. financial institutions and requires them to deal specifically with protecting account holders' private information. Payment card industry (PCI) refers to credit card processing requirements, International Organization for Standardization (ISO)/International electrotechnical commission (IEC) is a standards organization, and the Consumer Protection Act, while providing oversight for the protection of consumer private information, is limited in scope.

questions.question: The typical function of Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) in securing Wireless Application Protocol (WAP) is to protect transmissions that exist:
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations

choices.text: Between the WAP gateway and the wireless endpoint device
Between the web server and the WAP gateway
From the web server to the wireless endpoint device
Between the wireless device and the base station

questions.explanation: The purpose of SSL is to encrypt the communication channel between two end points. In this example, it is the end user and the server.

questions.question: What is an audit standard for service organizations?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Both SOC 1 and SOC 2 are report formats based on the SSAE 18 standard. While SOC 1 reports on controls for financial reporting, SOC 2 (Types 1 and 2) reports on controls associated with security or privacy.

questions.question: What is a company that purchases hosting services from a cloud server hosting or cloud computing provider who then resells to its own customers?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The cloud computing reseller purchases hosting services and then resells them.

questions.question: What is a type of computing comparable to grid computing that relies on sharing computing resources rather than having local servers or personal devices to handle applications?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Cloud computing is built on the model of grid computing whereby resources can be pooled and shared rather than having local devices do all the compute and storage functions.

questions.question: What is a set of technologies designed to analyze application source code and binaries for coding and design conditions that are indicative of security and vulnerabilities?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Static application security testing (SAST) differs from dynamic application security testing (DAST) in that it looks at source code and binaries to see if it can detect problems before the code is loaded into memory and run.

questions.question: All of the following are methods of data discovery, except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: All the others are valid methods of data discovery; user-based is a red herring with no meaning.

questions.question: Data labels could include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: All the others might be included in data labels, but we don't usually include data value, since it is prone to change frequently, and because it might not be information we want to disclose to anyone who does not have need to know.

questions.question: Data labels could include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: All the others might be included in data labels, but we don't include delivery vendor, which is nonsense in context.

questions.question: Data labels could include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: All the others might be included in data labels, but multifactor authentication is a procedure used for access control, not a label.

questions.question: All of the following are data analytics modes, except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: All the others are data analytics methods, but "refractory iterations" is a nonsense term thrown in as a red herring.

questions.question: In the cloud, the data owner is usually:
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The data owner is usually considered the cloud customer in a cloud configuration; the data in question is the customer's information, being processed in the cloud. The cloud provider is only leasing services and hardware to the customer. The cloud access security broker (CASB) only handles access control on behalf of the cloud customer, and is not in direct contact with the production data.

questions.question: In the cloud, the data processor is usually:
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: The party that assigns access rights

questions.explanation: In legal terms, when "data processor" is defined, it refers to anyone who stores, handles, moves, or manipulates data on behalf of the data owner or controller. In the cloud computing realm, this is the cloud provider.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an acceptable means of sanitizing hardware?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Hardware cannot be sanitized by deleting data. Deleting, as an operation, does not erase the data; it simply removes the logical pointers to the data for processing purposes. Burning, deletion, and drilling can all be used to sufficiently destroy the hardware to the point where data becomes irrecoverable.

questions.question: All policies within the organization should include a section that includes all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: All the elements except adjudication need to be addressed in each policy. Adjudication is not an element of policy.

questions.question: The most pragmatic option for data disposal in the cloud is which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: We don't have physical ownership, control, or even access to the devices holding the data, so physical destruction, including melting, is not an option. Overwriting is a possibility, but it is complicated by the difficulty of locating all the sectors and storage areas that might have contained our data, and by the likelihood that constant backups in the cloud increase the chance we'll miss something as it's being overwritten. Cryptoshredding is the only reasonable alternative. Cold fusion is a red herring.

questions.question: What is the intellectual property protection for the tangible expression of a creative idea?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Copyrights are protected tangible expressions of creative works.

questions.question: What is the intellectual property protection for a useful manufacturing innovation?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Patents protect processes (as well as inventions, new plantlife, and decorative patterns).

questions.question: What is the intellectual property protection for a very valuable set of sales leads?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Confidential sales and marketing materials unique to the organization are trade secrets.

questions.question: What is the intellectual property protection for a confidential recipe for muffins?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Confidential recipes unique to the organization are trade secrets.

questions.question: What is the intellectual property protection for the logo of a new video game?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Logos and symbols and phrases and color schemes that describe brands are trademarks.

questions.question: What is the aspect of the DMCA that has often been abused and places the burden of proof on the accused?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: The DMCA provision for takedown notices allows copyright holders to demand removal of suspect content from the web, and puts the burden of proof on whoever posted the material; this function has been abused by griefers and trolls and overzealous content producers. There is no toll exemption in DMCS The decryption program prohibition makes DeCSS and other similar programs illegal. Puppet plasticity is a nonsense term used for a distraction.

questions.question: What is the federal agency that accepts applications for new patents?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office accepts, reviews, and approves applications for new patents. The USDA creates and enforces agriculture regulation. OSHA oversees workplace safety regulations. The SEC regulates publicly traded corporations.

questions.question: IRM tools use a variety of methods for enforcement of intellectual property rights. These include all of the following except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: IRM solutions use all these methods except for dip switch validity, which is a nonsense term.

questions.question: Which of the following does not have a personal privacy law that limits the way all citizens and entities can share personal data?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The United States does not have a single, overarching personal privacy law; instead, the US often protects personal information by industry (HIPAA, GLBA, FERPA, and so forth.). Belgium, like all EU member countries, adheres to the GDPR. Argentina’s Personal Data Protection Act cleaves to the EU regulation, as does Japan’s Act on the Protection of Personal Information.

questions.question: IRM solutions should generally include all of the following functions, except:
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: IRMtools should include all the functions listed except for self-destruction, which might hurt someone.

questions.question: Gathering business requirements aids in determining information about organizational assets. Which of the following is not determined by this process?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Robustness is not a trait measured by the process of reviewing business requirements.

questions.question: Which of the following is one example of a data discovery method?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: There are several types of data discovery types: content based, label based, and metadata based. Metadata is the data about the data, such as file location, who created it, when was it created, and so on.

questions.question: Which of the following is a term used to describe the practice of obscuring original raw data so that only a portion is displayed for operational purposes?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Masking is a form of confidentiality assurance that often replaces the original information with asterisks or Xs.

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of modern data center design?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: One of the foundational design characteristics in modern data center design involves ensuring redundant power systems. Data centers can be located anywhere, and typically have strong physical security.

questions.question: What is the term used to describe the ease and efficiency of moving data from one provider to another?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Portability is the term used to describe the ease and efficiency of moving data from one cloud provider to another.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a characteristic of REST?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: REST is a stateless, lightweight, multiprotocol approach to providing web services. It does not rely on XML.

questions.question: In what cloud service model is the customer responsible for administration of the operating system?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: In the infrastructure as a service model, the customer is responsible for the operating system. In PaaS and SaaS, the provider is responsible.

questions.question: Which is the highest level of data center redundancy, according to the Uptime Institute?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: The Uptime Institute has four tiers of data center redundancy rating, with the highest being 4 and the lowest 1.

questions.question: Of the following, which type of test has the most impact on operations?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: A full test will always be the most comprehensive of tests. It includes every asset in the organization and all personnel.

questions.question: Which of the following has increased the viability of cloud services?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Virtualization allows scalable resource allocation, which has in turn dramatically increased the viability of cloud services.

questions.question: Which of the following takes advantage of the information developed in the business impact analysis (BIA)?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Among other things, the BIA gathers asset valuation information that is crucial to risk management analysis and further selection of security controls.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best example of a SIEM function?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: In addition to centralization of log streams, SIEMs provide the ability to do trend analysis and view dashboards of activity.

questions.question: What is the lowest tier of data center redundancy according to the Uptime Institute?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: There are four tiers of data center redundancy, with 1 being the lowest and 4 being the highest.

questions.question: What is a function common to many egress monitoring solutions?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Egress monitoring has nothing to do with elasticity, metered service, or satellite links. However, egress monitoring tools often feature data discovery functions.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best example of a countermeasure used to protect cloud operations against external attackers?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations

choices.text: Use of generic hardware in building infrastructure components

questions.explanation: Continual monitoring for anomalous activity is a great way to detect potential external attacks. The other answers have nothing to do with protecting cloud operations from external threats.

questions.question: Which of the following is included in the STRIDE model?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: The STRIDE threat model includes spoofing, tampering, repudiation, information disclosure, and elevation of privilege.

questions.question: Which of the following is the most important mechanism to ensure trust in the cloud provider's performance and duties?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: CSA Security Alliance Cloud Controls Matrix

questions.explanation: The contract between the provider and the customer provides trust between the two parties by holding the provider legally responsible for its contractual obligations.

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of liquid propane gas that makes it attractive as a fuel for backup generators?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: One primary advantage of LP gas is that it does not spoil the way gasoline and diesel fuel can. After sitting in tanks for extended periods, both diesel and gas will spoil and no longer burn properly.

questions.question: Of the following elements, which is the primary driver of security decisions?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Business requirements will and should always be what drives security decisions.

questions.question: Egress monitoring solutions can aid in reducing the possibility of losses due to ______.
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Egress monitoring tools can aid in reducing the possibility of inadvertent disclosures. They are not designed to assist in any of the other situations.

questions.question: Which of the following represents a technique to enhance the portability of cloud data?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Avoiding proprietary data formats will aid portability efforts. DRM, DLP, and audits have no impact on portability.

questions.question: What term best describes a set of technologies that analyze application source code, byte code, and binaries for coding and design problems that would indicate a security problem or vulnerability?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: DAST stands for dynamic application security testing and cannot analyze source code as it analyzes code while it is running. MFA stands for multifactor authentication, and STRIDE is a threat model concept.

questions.question: Of the following, which type of SSAE audit report is the cloud provider most likely to be willing to share without any additional participation from the cloud customer?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: SOC 3 is the least detailed report, designed for public dissemination. There is no SOC 3 Type 2 report.

questions.question: Which of the following terms is not associated with the STRIDE model?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Resiliency is not a component of the STRIDE model, which consists of spoofing, tampering, repudiation, information disclosure, and elevation of privilege.

questions.question: Inability to remotely access a cloud provider impacts which of the three elements of the CIA triad?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The element of availability is impacted if a remote user cannot access the cloud provider.

questions.question: In which cloud service model is the customer required to maintain and update only the applications?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: In the platform as a service model, the customer is paying for access to a (virtual) machine with an operating system on which to install applications. Since the customer owns the applications, it is their responsibility to keep the applications up to date.

questions.question: In which cloud service model is the customer responsible for only the data?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: In the SaaS model, the infrastructure, OS, and application are managed by the cloud provider.

questions.question: Egress monitoring solutions can aid in reducing the potential for loss due to ________.
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Egress monitoring tools identify outbound traffic that violates an organization's policies, such as when a malicious user attempts data exfiltration.

questions.question: Compliance with ASHRAE data center standards for humidity can help reduce the risk of which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: The ASHRAE standards provide for humidity standards that reduce the chances of static discharge, which could be catastrophic in a data center environment.

questions.question: Of the following, which does not represent a level of the CSA STAR certification program?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: SOC 2 Type 3 is not an actual report format. All of the other options are part of the levels of the CSA STAR certification program.

questions.question: Which of the following is a service that might be offered by a cloud access security broker (CASB)?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Cloud security access brokers typically provide services such as key escrow, single sign-on, and identity and access management. All of the other options are outside the scope of their activities.

questions.question: The ___________________ codifies the rights and responsibilities of the parties involved upon completion of negotiation.
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The SLA is the subset of the contract concerning service performance, and the other options are red herrings and have nothing to do with codification of rights and responsibilities.

questions.question: In cloud computing, which of the following best describes the data owner?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The cloud customer is generally accepted as the data owner.

questions.question: What is a technology that may lead to the ability to process encrypted data without having to decrypt it first?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Homomorphic encryption is an experimental technology that would allow ciphertext to be manipulated in processes and still produce the same results as when the unencrypted plaintext of the same data is processed.

questions.question: Which of the following does not represent an attack on a network?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: All of the rest of these options represent specific network attacks. Nmap is a relatively harmless scanning utility designed for network mapping. Although it can be used to gather information about a network as part of the process of developing an attack, it is not by itself an attack tool.

questions.question: When migrating to the cloud, which of the following dependencies are not important as part of the BIA review process?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: All options except D are important dependencies when reviewing the BIA.

questions.question: A _________________ is an isolated space where untested code and experimentation can safely occur separate from the production environment.
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: A sandbox is designed and used specifically for testing and experimenting in a manner in which live data cannot be harmed.

questions.question: Which of the following is a feature of SAST?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: Testing applications while running in RAM

questions.explanation: Static application security testing (SAST) examines source code while the application is not running.

questions.question: How long should an uninterruptible power supply (UPS) be able to run during a sustained power outage?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: Long enough to complete a graceful system shutdown

questions.explanation: A UPS is configured to safely shut down systems in order to save data in the event of a power failure.

questions.question: Which of the following terms is not associated with the CIA triad?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The CIA triad consists of confidentiality, integrity, and availability. Independence is a term used in the world of IT audits.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an example of encryption used in cloud computing?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Data masking is a technique whereby similar text strings are used in place of real data. Options A, B, and D are all examples of encryption in cloud computing.

questions.question: Of the following, who best represents the data processor in cloud computing?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The legal definition of a data processor is anyone who stores, handles, moves, or manipulates data on behalf of the data owner/controller. In the case of cloud computing, this is the cloud provider.

questions.question: Of the following, which term is most closely associated with egress monitoring tools?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Data classification is vital in egress monitoring solutions. This typically occurs at the time of data creation.

questions.question: What is the phase of an investigation where evidence is collected?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: eDiscovery is about gathering evidence.

questions.question: Of the following, which is not a feature of DAST?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: All of the other items listed are features of dynamic application security testing.

questions.question: How quickly should data center transfer switches bring backup power online in the event of a main failure?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: The purpose of the transfer switch is to redirect power consumption from utility power to generator power; this should be done fast enough to ensure power is available when the batteries fail.

questions.question: Of the following, which is an example of a technical control?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Audit trails are an example of a technical control. Fire suppression equipment, security policies, and configuration procedures are all examples of administrative controls.

questions.question: Of the following, which is the most important?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Health and human safety is always the paramount security concern.

questions.question: In order for tokenization to work properly, which of the following must be in place?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Tokenization requires two databases: one containing the raw, original data and a second that contains the tokens that map to the original data.

questions.question: In which of the following does the customer have the most control of their data and systems while the cloud provider will have the least amount of responsibility?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: In the infrastructure as a service model, the provider offers and manages the physical plant and connectivity to underlying hardware. All systems and data are the responsibility of the customer.

questions.question: Which of the following adds nothing or very little to enhancing trust of the cloud provider?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: CCTV surveillance generally does very little to enhance the trust of a cloud provider. The other factors provide information as to the integrity of security operations, which is highly valued and will add to the trust factor of the cloud provider.

questions.question: Which of the following not a feature of a secure KVM (keyboard/video/mouse) component?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: A TPM (Trusted Platform Module) is a security device found on an individual machine and is designed to store encryption keys securely. Options A, C, and D are all features of secure KVMs.

questions.question: A threat coupled with vulnerability is best defined as a ______________.
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: A vulnerability combined with a specific threat is defined as a risk.

questions.question: Which of the following is the kind of hypervisor preferred by hackers due to its increased attack surface?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Type II hypervisors are appealing to attackers because they have more potential for flaws and vulnerabilities due to the fact that there is an operating system running underneath the hypervisor.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best example of a technical control?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Only access control lists are a technical control. Door locks are a physical control, and both the policy and guidelines represent administrative controls.

questions.question: Which of the following is a service that provides replication of data across various locations?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: A content delivery network (CDN) is a service that distributes data.

questions.question: After a cloud migration, risks must be reviewed. However, a complete analysis is not necessary because much of the material has already been compiled in which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: The cost-benefit analysis completed prior to migration

questions.explanation: Most of the risks associated with the cloud migration are examined in the cost-benefit phase of evaluation and therefore do not need to be revisited.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an acceptable practice for user access control administration?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Provider provides administration on behalf of the customer
Customer provides access administration on behalf of provider
Third party provides administration on behalf of the customer

questions.explanation: The customer never provides access control on behalf of the provider. All the other options are acceptable.

questions.question: Of the following data center redundancy characteristics, which will be in place regardless of tier?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Human life is always the first priority, so all data centers must have an emergency egress. The other characteristics will only be in place and associated with specific tiers.

questions.question: Which of the following is the most important in a BC/DR incident?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: A BC/DR event is no time to be scrambling around trying to figure out what to do. Having a plan in place and executing it is dependent on everyone understanding the plan, and checklists are the way we work through steps of the plan in order.

questions.question: Of the following, which is not associated with vendor lock-in?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Statutory compliance refers to state and federal laws. They cannot force a customer to stay with a cloud provider. However, all the rest are problems that can lead to vendor lock-in.

questions.question: Of the following, which is the most practical and secure type of data disposal in the cloud?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Crypto-shredding is the most practical method for cloud environments. The others are not realistic in that they require physical access to the facility or logical access to all hardware the data has been stored on, which is not pragmatic in a cloud environment.

questions.question: Poorly negotiated contracts can cause many problems. Of the following, which is not an example of what can happen when contracts are not properly negotiated?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Malware is not the result of a poorly negotiated cloud contract. However, unfavorable terms, paying for services not used, and vendor lock-in are all possible effects of a poorly negotiated contract.

questions.question: A set of routines, standards, protocols, and tools for building software applications to access a web-based software application or tool is best described by which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: The application programming interface (API) is a set of routines, standards, protocols, and tools for building software applications to access a web-based software application or tool.

questions.question: Of the following, which represents the audit results in an SSAE audit dealing with confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The SOC 2 report deals specifically with what are called the trust principles, and they include the CIA triad. The SOC 1 is designed for reviewing financial controls, and there is no “SOX” audit.

questions.question: When you are designing redundancy and contingency planning in a data center, which of the following is the most important consideration?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: While the other options are important, they are all subordinate to human health and safety, which is the first priority of any security program.

questions.question: Of the following, whose advice should be given the most weight on the decision to patch a live production system?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: The vendor should be the one advising when and how to patch a system as they will have the most up-to-date information and it will be their patches you are applying.

questions.question: Of the following, which is most closely associated with financial controls?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The SOC 1 report is primarily for reporting on financial controls.

questions.question: Which of the following best represent the three distinct levels of the CSA STAR program?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Third-party assessment, attestation, and ongoing monitoring
Self-assessment, attestation, and ongoing monitoring certification

questions.explanation: Self-assessment, attestation, and ongoing monitoring certification are the three levels of STAR certification.

questions.question: Which term best describes when a cloud provider goes out of business and leaves the customer unable to retrieve data?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: This is the definition of vendor lock-out: when the cloud provider goes out of business and you can no longer access your data. This must be considered when you are determining whether to cloud migration.

questions.question: Of the following, which is not directly related to DLP?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Data loss protection (DLP) are tools for egress monitoring, and regulatory compliance and policy enforcement are some of their goals. High-speed bandwidth has no direct relationship to DLP.

questions.question: Which of the following is the term used for the intellectual property protection for the tangible expression of creative ideas?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Copyrights are designed to protect tangible expressions of creative works, like books, articles, music, and so on.

questions.question: Object and volume storage are used with ___________________.
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Object and volume storage are both related to infrastructure.

questions.question: The application normative framework is best described as _________.
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: The application framework is a subset of the organizational framework with a many-to-one relationship.

questions.question: Of the following SOC reports, which is the most commonly advertised?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The SOC 3 report is merely an attestation by an auditor. It does not contain any confidential information and is therefore readily available upon request and often even advertised on websites.

questions.question: All of the following should be represented in the configuration/change management board except ___________________.
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: All others should be represented in CMB activities.

questions.question: Which of the following best represents the primary function of a SOC 3 report?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The SOC 3 report is an attestation that an evaluation has occurred and that everything passed. It contains no details.

questions.question: Which of the following is the intermediary who provides connectivity and transport of cloud services between cloud providers and cloud customers?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The cloud carrier is distinct in that they provide connectivity and transport services between cloud providers and customers. Brokers and providers provide other services, and there is no such thing as a cloud proxy.

questions.question: Of the following, which is not a characteristic of cloud computing?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: White-box testing tests the program logic and is used for unit and integration testing. It has nothing to do with cloud characteristics.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a process used in device hardening?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: While having secondary redundant power supplies helps with device redundancy, it has nothing to do with device hardening. Each of the other options helps in the hardening process.

questions.question: Of the following, which would be used to protect the intellectual property of a manufacturing process?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Patents are designed to protect the intellectual property of processes.

questions.question: What is the primary function of a hardware security module (HSM)?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security

choices.text: Safely stores and manages encryption keys

questions.explanation: The HSM is a device embedded into the hardware of another device and is used to store encryption keys. If implemented properly, it is far stronger than saving and storing keys in software.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a good example of countermeasures designed to protect cloud operations from internal threats?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Vendor lock-out refers to a cloud provider no longer providing service, which is an external problem. All the rest are valid methods of protecting against internal threats.

questions.question: Which of the following is a standard for exchanging authentication and authorization of data between security domains?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: This is the definition of SAML. None of the other options has anything to do with authentication or authorization.

questions.question: When monitoring for performance reasons, which of the following should not be included?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Print spooling is not an accepted performance measure. All the others are critical to keeping the environment running at peak efficiency.

questions.question: With regard to PII stored in the cloud, who is ultimately responsible for the security of that PII?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The cloud customer is always the data owner and therefore ultimately responsible for the security of PII.

questions.question: Which of the following is a technique used in hardening a device?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Updating and keeping systems patched is one of the most effective ways to keep them secure. If you were to encrypt the OS, you would not be able to use the system, and SSL and PKI refer to ways of protecting communications.

questions.question: Of the following, which would be used to protect a company's sales lead information?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Information specific to a company and that is unique to them would be covered under the term trade secret.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of best practices for storing encryption keys?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security

choices.text: Putting on a thumb drive and removed

questions.explanation: You never want to store encryption keys with the data they are protecting. They should always be stored on a separate system. However, a thumb drive does not constitute a separate system and could easily lead to key compromise.

questions.question: Which of the following is one example of a way to protect a data center from the impact of external threats?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Having redundant ISPs or carriers provides the data center with protection against such external threats as DDoS, intentional fiber cuts, and similar effects.

questions.question: Regardless of cloud deployment or service model, the customer will always be allowed access to which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Regardless of model, the customer owns the data and will therefore always be allowed access to it.

questions.question: Which of the following has never caused a data center outage?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: A change in regulations has never resulted in a data center outage, but each of the other options has caused many outages.

questions.question: When a system is put into maintenance mode, which of the following occurs?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations

choices.text: All active production instances are removed and new logins are prevented while logging continues.
All active production instances are removed while logging continues.
New logins are prevented while logging continues.
All active production instances are suspended and new logins are prevented while logging continues.

questions.explanation: This is the only option that includes all of the maintenance mode actions.

questions.question: Which of the following would be used to learn the critical paths, processes, and assets of an organization?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Business impact analysis (BIA) is designed to identify and ascertain the value of assets in addition to the critical paths and processes.

questions.question: Which type of intellectual property protection would apply to a secret recipe?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: A recipe that is not secret could be protected by a patent.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a countermeasure designed to protect against internal threats?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: All except option D are designed to protect against unreliable personnel actions, including by cloud administrators.

questions.question: Security controls for all types of cloud services and models are driven primarily by which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Security controls should always be based on the needs of the business. Regulations, state laws, and best practices may all shape the business requirements but are not direct drivers themselves.

questions.question: Of the following, which is a valid reason for a baseline to change?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: The best reason for changing a baseline is numerous change requests. If too many changes are being requested, it is a sign that the baseline needs to be reviewed and changed in order to meet these new demands.

questions.question: Which of the following is the cloud deployment model where organizational ownership of the hardware and infrastructure belong to and can only be used by a single customer?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The private cloud model is where ownership and usage are limited to a single customer. IaaS and PaaS are service models, and the hybrid cloud model may allow shared resources.

questions.question: Of the following, which is responsible for determining an organization's risk appetite?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Senior management determines the risk appetite of an organization.

questions.question: Of the following, which would be used to protect the intellectual property of a logo for a business?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Trademarks are designed to protect symbols such as a company logo or trade name.

questions.question: How should cryptographic keys be protected?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security

choices.text: To a level at least as high as the data they are protecting

questions.explanation: Cryptographic keys should always be protected with safeguards at least as stringent, if not more, than the level of the data they are protecting.

questions.question: Which of the following is a countermeasure designed to protect against internal threats?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Of the choices, separation of duties is the best answer. Separation of duties ensures that no single person in an organization can violate security protocols by themselves. Web application firewalls are designed to protect against external threats, as are penetration tests. Conflicts of interest are not applicable to the question.

questions.question: Who is ultimately legally responsible for data loss or disclosure in the cloud?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The cloud customer, also the data owner, is always ultimately legally responsible for unauthorized disclosures.

questions.question: Battery backups or UPSs serve many purposes. Along with providing power, which of the following do they provide?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Battery backups also provide a critical function in that they condition the line. What this means is that they add and suppress power curves that are a part of normal minute-by-minute fluctuations in voltage and amperage delivered. This smoothing out, or conditioning, helps equipment to last much longer since it is no longer subjected to varying voltages or amperage.

questions.question: Which of the following cloud deployment models features ownership by a cloud service provider with service offerings for anyone interested?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The private cloud model is not open to anyone interested, and IaaS is a service model. In addition, the community model has restrictions as to who may join.

questions.question: After all controls and countermeasure are put in place and operating effectively, the risk left over is referred to as ________.
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Residual risk literally means the risk left over. In this case, it refers to risk left over after all controls and countermeasures are in place.

questions.question: The Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) criminalizes the production or dissemination of which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
