choices.text: Distribution technology intended to circumvent copyright protection and the works they protect
Pornographic material intended to circumvent measures that control access to copyrighted works
Technology or services intended to be used in terrorist activity
Technology, devices, or services intended to circumvent copyright techniques used to protect digital media such as video and audio recordings

questions.explanation: The DMCA criminalizes the production or dissemination of technology, devices, or services intended to circumvent copyright techniques used to protect digital media such as video and audio recordings; this includes some decryption tools.

questions.question: Which of the following are examples of attacks blocked by web application firewalls (WAFs)?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: WAFs are particularly suited for blocking and stopping XSS and SQL injection attacks. Xmas tree and Syn flood attacks occur at the network level and so do not apply. Code forgery is a made-up term.

questions.question: Which model provides the most secure, isolated environment for a cloud customer to conduct software development and testing?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: PaaS allows the cloud customer to install any kind of software, including software to be tested, on an architecture that includes any desired operating systems.

questions.question: Of the following, which is not a consideration when planning for physical security concerns?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Local languages have nothing to do with physical security. All the others are valid concerns.

questions.question: Deviations from baselines should be ______.
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Any deviations from baselines should be thoroughly investigated and documented. If there are valid reasons for the deviation, the baseline may need to be reviewed and/or changed.

questions.question: Which of the following best represents the concept of the community cloud?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Features joint responsibility among users of a single customer
Features joint ownership of assets among a member group
Features joint ownership of software among a member group
Features ownership of assets by cloud provider

questions.explanation: The community cloud is defined by its joint ownership of assets among a member group.

questions.question: Which of the following is something you cannot do when dealing with risk?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Risk cannot be reversed. It can only be mitigated, transferred, or accepted.

questions.question: The data life cycle has six stages. Of the following, which is the correct sequence?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Create, Store, Use, Share, Archive, Destroy
Create, Store, Share, Use, Archive, Destroy
Create, Use, Store, Share, Archive, Destroy
Create, Store, Use, Share, Archive, Delete

questions.explanation: Option A shows the proper sequence.

questions.question: In order to provide a secure environment for application testing, which service model would be the best fit?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: PaaS (platform as a service) allows the customer to install and run any applications they want on any operating system environment they may need.

questions.question: What is a good way to secure devices in a BYOD environment?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Of these answers, the best one would be to use encryption on devices. BYOD devices may be lost or stolen, and this would prevent unauthorized viewing of data.

questions.question: Which of the following is a DRM solution for protecting intellectual property rights?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Media-present checks look to see if protected media is present before allowing content to be played or distributed.

questions.question: Of the following, which would be most useful in a disaster that is primarily local, such as an interruption of communications service?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Having a joint operating agreement with a sister facility can assist greatly when dealing with a local disaster that does not affect a large area.

questions.question: In regard to recent EU regulations concerning privacy, which of the following represents the right to be forgotten?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: The subject's right to have all data about them completely erased from a provider's environment
The right to have all of a data owner's personal information erased from a provider's environment
The right to have incorrect data erased
The right to have all criminal data erased

questions.explanation: In the EU, privacy is considered a human right, and the subject (the human individual identified by the data) has the power over how their identifying data is distributed/used/stored. A subject can request that a service provider erase all data about the subject, and the provider must comply to avoid criminal charges for noncompliance.

questions.question: Which of the following cloud service models requires the least amount of maintenance, administration, and support by the cloud customer?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The software as a service (SaaS) model requires the least intervention because the provider is responsible for maintaining the operating system, hardware, and software.

questions.question: Which of the following is not an example of hardening devices?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Removal of admin accounts is not an option — without them you could not administer the devices. All other options are valid.

questions.question: Of the following bodies, which does not have a comprehensive federal privacy law that protects its citizens' personal data?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The United States is the only entity in this list that does not have a comprehensive policy directed at protecting its citizens' privacy.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes DAST?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: Tests performed on an application or software product while it is being executed in memory
Tests performed on an application or software product that involves a code review
Tests performed on an application or software product without the user's knowledge
Tests performed on a network while it is being executed in memory

questions.explanation: Dynamic application security testing is testing conducted while the application is resident in memory and being executed.

questions.question: Of the following, which cloud data storage process uses encrypted chunks of data?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Data dispersion uses chunks of data, erasure coding, and encryption.

questions.question: How long should the fuel that is stored for data center generators be able to keep the data center up?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Based on Uptime Institute guidelines, enough fuel should be on hand to keep the generator running for at least 12 hours regardless of the data center tier.

questions.question: What is a situation in which more users are connected to a system than can be fully supported?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The question is the definition of oversubscription. This can happen in a multitenant environment like cloud computing if not properly managed.

questions.question: Which of the following is a technology solution for securing databases?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Database activity monitoring (DAM) is a security technology used for monitoring and analyzing database activity that operates independently of the database management system. NIST is the National Institute of Standards and Technology, SAST is a type of application testing, and SAML is a technology used with identity access management.

questions.question: Which of the following is the act of identifying or verifying the eligibility of a station, originator, or individual to access specific information?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Option B is typically a measure designed to protect against fraudulent transmission by establishing the validity of a transmission, message, station, or originator.

questions.question: A formal policy that is signed by management and acknowledged by the user is known as a ___________________.
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The acceptable use policy (AUP) is designed to make clear to employees what is acceptable as well as unacceptable use of company-owned computing equipment and data such as email.

questions.question: What is a term that describes very large sets of information that are used to determine trends and other patterns generally undetectable by humans?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Big data refers to extremely large data sets used to determine patterns and trends such as purchasing or travel trends of large groups of people.

questions.question: What is an important term in the field of data forensics that refers to maintaining control of evidence?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Chain of custody refers to documenting control of evidence from the time it is collected until it is presented to the court.

questions.question: ________________ is a term used to describe an arrangement that can be made among multiple enterprises to let subscribers use the same identification data to obtain access to all enterprises in the network.
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Federation is an arrangement that can be made among multiple enterprises allowing them to use the same identification data to obtain access to all enterprises' resources within the group.

questions.question: What is the name of the security discipline that enables the right individuals to access the right resources at the right time and for the right reasons?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: The security discipline is called IAM (identitification and access management), and it ensures that the right user always has access to the right resources at the right times for the right reasons, based on their identity.

questions.question: What are the activities involving the generation, storage, distribution, deletion, archiving, and application of keys in accordance with a formal security policy?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: These are all activities associated with encryption key management and are critical for the safety and security of key usage.

questions.question: The ____________________ controls the entire infrastructure and is independent of physical network configuration.
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: The management plane is used to create logical networking connections regardless of physical layout.

questions.question: ________ are software or devices that monitor networks or systems for malicious activities or policy violations and produce electronic alerts and/or reports to a management station.
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Network intrusion detection systems (NIDSs) watch for anomalous or malicious system activity at the network level and provide alerts and/or reports on such activity.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a qualitative risk assessment?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: Typically employs a set of methods, principles, or rules for assessing risk based on numerical categories
Typically employs a set of methods, principles, or rules for assessing risk based on numbers
Typically employs a set of methods, principles, or rules for assessing risk based on nonnumerical categories
Typically employs a set of methods, principles, or rules for assessing risk based on threat categories

questions.explanation: As opposed to quantitative assessments, which use specific numerical values such as 1, 2, and 3, qualitative assessments use nonnumerical categories that are relative in nature, such as high, medium, and low.

questions.question: Which term refers to a system's ability to cordon off or protect certain aspects of the compute environment such as processing, memory, and other resources needed in the compute transaction?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Sandboxing is often used for testing applications in development or carving out resources that cannot then touch other parts of the same system.

questions.question: _________________ is the idea of identifying specific points of vulnerability and then implementing countermeasures to protect or thwart those points from successful exploitation.
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Threat modeling is used specifically to identify points of vulnerability in order to implement countermeasures as part of the overall system protection activity.

questions.question: ________________ refers to the idea of a cloud provider or solution not allowing the customer to move their applications or data in the event the customer needs or wants to do so.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Vendor lock-in is a serious concern for the cloud customer.

questions.question: A/an ________________ specifies which users or system processes have access to a specific object such as an application or process in addition to what operations they can perform.
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: An access control list (ACL) specifies which users or system processes have access to an object.

questions.question: ___________________ is a database security technology for monitoring and analyzing database activity that operates independently of the DBMS and does not rely on native (DBMS resident) auditing or native logs.
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: DAM is designed to watch database activity natively, so it does not rely on other logs or log systems such as SIEMs.

questions.question: What is a process in which electronic data is sought for the purposes of using it as evidence in a civil or criminal case?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: eDiscovery refers to locating data to be used in civil or criminal proceedings.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes federation?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: Allows a single user to authenticate using a process that then allows access across multiple IT systems or even organizations
Allows a single user to authenticate in a cloud environment

questions.explanation: Federated SSO allows users to authenticate once but then be granted access to resources of other federated organizations within the federation.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes HIPAA?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: US federal law for electronic healthcare transactions and national identifiers for providers, health plans, and employers
EU standards for electronic healthcare transactions and national identifiers for providers, health plans, and employers
Contractual standards for electronic healthcare transactions and national identifiers for providers, health plans, and employers
ISO standards for electronic healthcare transactions and national identifiers for providers, health plans, and employers

questions.explanation: Passed in 1996 as the Health Portability and Accountability Act, it provides the standards for electronic healthcare transactions and national identifiers for providers, health plans, and employers.

questions.question: Which of the following terms best describes a logical grouping of devices that allows traffic to be contained and operate at high speeds?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: LANs are the backbone of the infrastructure because they do exactly this.

questions.question: ________________ storage is used when files are stored with additional metadata and are accessible through APIs and web interfaces.
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Objects (files) are stored with additional metadata such as content type, redundancy requirements, creation dates, and so on and are then accessible via APIs and/or through a web interface.

questions.question: A penetration test is designed to ___________.
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: Test a system for vulnerabilities that would allow an attacker to gain control over said system
Test a system, network, or web application for vulnerabilities that would allow an attacker to gain control over said system, network, or application

questions.explanation: A penetration test is a test that is designed to take advantage of any vulnerability it can find to compromise a system or gain unauthorized access. This includes testing not just systems but also networks and applications.

questions.question: A _____________ typically employs a set of methods, principles, or rules for assessing risk based on absolute numerical values.
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: A quantitative assessment employs a set of methods or rules much like a qualitative assessment, with the difference being the use of absolute numerical values. So instead of high, medium, and low, values such as 1, 2, and 3 are used.

questions.question: All of the following entitles are required to use FedRAMP-accredited cloud service providers except ___________________.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Federal Express is a private company; only federal entities are required to comply with FedRAMP. All the other options are federal entities.

questions.question: The ____________ is designed to determine the damage caused from losing the support/availability of any particular resource to an organization.
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: The business impact analysis (BIA) determines the impact on a business from the loss of support or availability of any resource.

questions.question: ___________ is a method of hiding data with substitute characters such as Xs or asterisks.
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: This is an example of data masking. Sandboxing and virtualization are ways to abstract programs away from actual hardware. Encryption uses a two-way process to convert plaintext to ciphertext; changing letters to Xs or asterisks is not encryption, as it is not reversible.

questions.question: This approach to public key cryptography uses much smaller keys than traditional cryptography to provide the same level of security.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Elliptical curve cryptography (ECC) uses algebraic elliptical curves that result in much smaller keys that can provide the same level of safety as much larger ones used in traditional key cryptography.

questions.question: A ______________ consists of a computer, data, or a network site that appears to be part of a network but is actually isolated and monitored. It also appears to contain data or resources of value that are in fact fake.
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: A honeypot consists of a computer, data, or a network site that appears to be part of a network and seems to contain information or a resource of value to attackers but is actually isolated and monitored. Although a honeypot may be run in a sandbox, they are not the same thing.

questions.question: Which of the following is not typically a BC/DR construct involving cloud computing?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: On-premises production environment; cloud BC/DR environment
Cloud production environment; same provider BC/DR environment
Cloud production environment; different provider BC/DR environment
Cloud production environment; on-premises BC/DR environment

questions.explanation: Organizations do not typically host contingency operations at an on-premises facility when they already operate a production environment in the cloud. All the other options are common BC/DR arrangements involving cloud computing.

questions.question: MTTR is best described as which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: The average cost to repair a device that has failed or is in need of repair
The average time it takes to replace a device that has failed or is in need of repair
The average time it takes to repair a device that has failed or is in need of repair
The maximum time it takes to repair a device that has failed or is in need of repair

questions.explanation: Mean time to repair (MTTR) is the time required to repair a device that has failed or is in need of repair. The term mean indicates the average time as opposed to the actual or past experiences.

questions.question: Which of the following represents the Security and Privacy Controls for US Federal Information Systems and Organizations?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: NIST 800-53 r4 describes ways to ensure the proper application of appropriate security requirements and security controls to all US federal government information and information management. The others are legitimate NIST documents with different purposes.

questions.question: Which form of authentication is used to enable SSO and enables the user to log into more than one application or website using the same credentials?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: OpenID is one form of authentication used to enable SSO and enables the user to log into more than one application or website using the same credentials.

questions.question: Which form of cloud storage applies to storing an individual's data in the cloud while providing access from anywhere?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Personal cloud storage is the storage of a single user's data in the cloud, allowing them access from anywhere on the Internet.

questions.question: REST is best described by which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: Does not rely on best practices for web services
Relies on stateless, client-server, cacheable communications

questions.explanation: Representational State Transfer (REST) relies on stateless, client-server, cacheable communications. It is a software architecture consisting of guidelines and best practices for creating scalable web services.

questions.question: Security Assertion Markup Language is ________.
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: SAML is an XML-based, open standard data format designed for the exchange of authentication and authorization data between parties.

questions.question: _____________ is an agentless means of ensuring a VM's security baseline does not change over time by examining such things as physical location and network settings.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Virtual machine introspection (VMI) is an agentless means of ensuring a VM's security baseline does not change over time by examining things such as physical address, network settings, and installed OS. These ensure that the baseline has not been inadvertently or maliciously tampered with.

questions.question: A database activity monitor (DAM) functions at layer ___________________ of the OSI model.
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: A DAM is a Layer 7 appliance. All the other options are incorrect.

questions.question: The practice of using strong magnets to erase and scramble data on magnetic media is called ___________.
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Degaussing refers to the practice of using strong magnets for scrambling data on magnetic media such as hard drives and tapes. Although scrubbing generally can scramble data as well as degaussing, it does not use magnets.

questions.question: A special piece of numeric code that allows encryption hardware or software to encrypt and then decrypt a message is called a/an ___________.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: An encryption key is the numeric string that allows for encryption and decryption to occur.

questions.question: The US government program that mandates a standardized approach to security assessments, authorization, and continuous monitoring of cloud products and services is called ______________.
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: FedRAMP is a US federal program that mandates a standardized approach to security assessments, authorization, and continuous monitoring of cloud products and services. FedRAMP certification can be quite costly and difficult to achieve but is required for cloud hosting services provided to a US government agency or contractor.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of two-factor authentication?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Only option D involves two distinct factors (something you know and something you are).

questions.question: Which of the following is used to describe a framework of application security best practices that have been catalogued and are leveraged by the organization and contain at least one or more subcomponents?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: An Organization Normative Framework (ONF) is a framework of so-called containers of application security best practices catalogued and leveraged by the organization and contains at least one or more subcomponents known as application normative frameworks (ANFs).

questions.question: Which of the following is a popular API construction model?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Representational State Transfer (REST) is a method for designing APIs at the moment. Graphical user interface (GUI), Hypertext Markup Language (HTML), and single sign-on (SSO) are not means of programming APIs; options A, B, and D are incorrect.

questions.question: What has enabled cloud computing to become a real and scalable service offering due primarily to savings, sharing capabilities, and allocation of resources across multiple tenants and environments?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Virtualization technologies have been the driving force behind enabling cloud computing to become a real and scalable service due to the savings, sharing, and allocation of resources across multiple tenants and environments.

questions.question: Which of the following terms best describes the amount an organization should expect to lose on an annual basis due to a specific type of incident?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: The term that best describes the amount an organization should expect to lose on an annual basis due to one type of incident is annual loss expectancy (ALE) and is calculated by multiplying the annual rate of occurrence (ARO) by the single loss expectancy (SLE).

questions.question: What is the principal issue concerning transborder data flow?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Differences may exist in customs or procedures.
Legal requirements may not be the same.

questions.explanation: The concern with transborder data flow is that the legal requirements may be different between the countries. An additional concern with transborder data flow is that the level of risk may be different depending on privacy laws and laws affecting intellectual property, such as trademark and copyright.

questions.question: Both short-term and long-term strategies designed to assist organizations in recovering from activities that disrupt critical functions are called ___________________.
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Business continuity (BC) and disaster recovery (DR) are both strategies designed to aid organizations in recovering from disruptions in activities. They can cover both short-term and long-term strategies.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the purpose of a DMZ?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Isolates public-facing network elements that would otherwise be vulnerable to attack
Isolates email servers that are Internet facing and protects them from attacks
Provides network elements such as routers that are Internet facing to protect them from attack

questions.explanation: A demilitarized zone (DMZ) isolates network elements that are public facing and would otherwise be vulnerable to attack.

questions.question: Which theoretical type of encryption technology enables the processing of encrypted data without the need to decrypt data in order to perform computations?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Homomorphic encryption would enable the processing of encrypted data without the need to first decrypt it; it has never been proven outside research situations.

questions.question: The OWASP is a nonprofit international organization focused on improving ___________________.
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: The Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) is an international nonprofit that focuses on identifying software vulnerabilities and educating developers in the practice of secure coding.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a way for customers to rent hardware, operating systems, storage, and network capacity over the Internet from a cloud service provider?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Platform as a service (PaaS) is what cloud customers use when they need to rent hardware, operating systems, storage, and network capacity over the Internet.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the use of several smaller disks rather than a single large disk for storage purposes as well as redundancy and speed?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Redundant array of independent disks (RAID) is a way of using a group of smaller and usually less-expensive disks as opposed to a single large disk. Different RAID levels provide varying degrees of redundancy and speed based on the number of disks used and the manner in which they are deployed.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the formal, legal agreement between two or more organizations that may or may not contain incentives and/or penalties?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: The service-level agreement (SLA) is a formal agreement between two or more organizations that may or may not contain incentives or penalties. The primary use of the SLA is to determine if the provider is in fact providing the services being purchased.

questions.question: Which of the following terms is not associated with cloud forensics?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: Plausibility, here, is a distractor and not specifically relevant to cloud forensics.

questions.question: What is the primary characteristic of volume storage?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security

choices.text: They are volumes attached to virtual storage and act or behave just like a physical drive or array.
They are drives attached to physical storage and act or behave just like a physical drive or array.
They are volumes attached to physical storage and act or behave just like a physical drive or array.
They are drives attached to virtual storage and act or behave just like a physical drive or array.

questions.explanation: Volume storage consists of volumes that are attached to virtual storage and act or behave just like a physical drive or array.

questions.question: Which federal standard is for the accreditation of secure and well-architected cryptographic modules produced by private sector vendors?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: FIPS 140-2 is the federal standard for the accreditation and distinguishing of secure and well-architected cryptographic modules produced by private sector vendors who see to or are in the process of having their solutions and services certified by the US government departments and regulated industries that collect, store, transfer, or share data that is deemed to be sensitive but not classified.

questions.question: ________________ systems provide air management that separates the cool air from the heat produced as exhaust of servers.
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Heating, ventilation, and air-conditioning (HVAC) systems separate the cool air from the heat caused by servers. They provide air management including racks with built-in ventilation or alternate cold/hot aisles.

questions.question: Which piece of the security triad is about ensuring that data is accurate and complete?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Integrity ensures that data has not been altered by an unauthorized entity. That includes being complete and accurate.

questions.question: What is the property whereby a sender cannot deny they sent a message?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Nonrepudiation is a term that describes the idea that an author of a file or message cannot deny having created it.

questions.question: Which type of information can be traced back to an individual user, sometimes through the use of tracking cookies?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Personally identifiable information (PII) is a legal category of information that identifies a specific person.

questions.question: The term RPO is best described by which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: A term used in BC and DR describing an acceptable amount of data that might be lost due to an outage before severe consequences are experienced
A term used in BC and DR describing a point in time after which an outage has occurred, beyond which recovery becomes extremely difficult or impossible
A term used in BC and DR describing the minimum allowable amount of data that might be lost due to an outage before severe consequences are experienced
A term used in BC and DR describing the maximum allowable amount of value that might be lost due to an outage before consequences are experienced

questions.explanation: Recovery point objective (RPO) is a term used in BC and DR describing the tolerable amount of data that might be lost due to an outage before severe consequences are experienced.

questions.question: Secret sharing made short (SSMS) is a method of which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: SSMS is a method of bit splitting that uses the three phases: encryption, using an information dispersal algorithm, and splitting the encryption key using the secret sharing algorithm. The fragments are signed and distributed to different cloud storage services, making it difficult to decrypt without both arbitrarily chosen data and encryption key fragments.

questions.question: Which of the following identifies vulnerabilities in applications, operating systems, or network devices?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: A vulnerability assessment or scan is designed to identify known vulnerabilities in applications, operating systems, or network devices. An Nmap scan may discover vulnerabilities but is designed primarily as a network services discovery tool and is not generally used with applications.

questions.question: Which of the following describes the act of permanently and completely removing personal identifiers from data, such as converting personally identifiable information (PII) into aggregated data?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Anonymization is the act of permanently and completely removing personal identifiers from data. Disk scrubbing, degaussing, and crypto-shredding each refers to eliminating all data, not just PII.

questions.question: _______________ often uses access control and encryption to prevent unauthorized copying and limitation of distribution to only those who pay.
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Information rights management (IRM) is a means to prevent unauthorized copying and limitation of distribution to only those who pay for content.

questions.question: Which regulation introduced significant changes for data processors and controllers who work across international borders?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The European Union General Data Protection Regulation of 2016 (EU GDPR 2016) introduced significant changes for data processors and controllers operating in and across the EU. Some of those changes included the concept of consent, transfers abroad, the right to be forgotten, establishment of the data protection officer, home state regulation, and increased sanctions.

questions.question: A ________________ is generally a type of network device designed to allow only authorized traffic through its interfaces.
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: A firewall is a type of network device that allows only authorized traffic to flow across its interfaces.

questions.question: MTD/MAD is a measure of which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: A point in time after an outage has occurred and beyond which recovery becomes extremely difficult or impossible
The optimal time it takes to recover a system after an outage
A weak point in a specific program that makes it unrecoverable after an outage has occurred
A point in time before an incident occurs

questions.explanation: The maximum tolerable downtime/maximum allowable downtime (MTD/MAD) is a point in time after an outage has occurred and beyond which recovery becomes extremely difficult or impossible.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a Type 1 hypervisor?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Synchronization device for cloud IT environments
Uses a minimal piece of software to manage the underlying hardware resources such as RAM, CPU, and storage
Access control mechanism for cloud administrators
Uses a separate piece of hardware to manage the underlying hardware resources such as RAM, CPU, and storage

questions.explanation: A Type 1 hypervisor uses a minimal piece of software to manage the underlying resources. A Type 2 hypervisor is a piece of software installed on top of or as part of a device's operating system.

questions.question: A(n) ________________________ is a combination of two or more distinct cloud infrastructures that remain unique entities but are bound together by standardized or proprietary technology that enables data and application portability.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: A hybrid cloud is a combination of two or more distinct cloud infrastructures that remain unique entities but are bound together by standardized or proprietary technology that enables data and application portability.

questions.question: Which of the following standards helps organizations to establish and maintain an ISMS?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: ISO 27001 describes an information security management system (ISMS) as a set of interrelated elements that organizations use to manage and control information security risks to protect and preserve the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the cloud computing term portability?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: The ability to move operations from one cloud provider to another (or out of the cloud)
Speed of processing and quality of service

questions.explanation: Portability refers to the ease with which a customer can leave a specific cloud provider without undue loss or harm.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a Service Organization Controls 1 (SOC 1) report?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Is relevant to a user entity's internal controls over the five security principles
Focuses on the user entity's internal controls over financial reporting
Focuses on the user entity's internal controls over the vendor management process
Focuses on the user entity's internal controls over proper access and authorization

questions.explanation: An SOC 1 report focuses on the user entity's internal controls over financial reporting.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the term ROI?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: Used to describe part of the SDLC
Used to describe a particular SaaS
Used to describe a profitability ratio
Used to describe a software rollout phase

questions.explanation: Return on investment (ROI) is a term used to describe a profitability ratio. It is generally calculated by dividing net profit by net assets.

questions.question: The SOC 2 report covers which of the following security principles?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: Security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, privacy

questions.explanation: SOC 2 reports are relevant to the target entity's internal controls over the five security principles of security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy.

questions.question: Which hierarchical database contains mappings of domain names to various types of data such as IP addresses?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: The Domain Name System (DNS) consists of a hierarchical database mapping of domain names to various data types such as IP addresses. DNS allows you to find human-readable or “friendly” names such as www.isc2.org as opposed to having to remember long IP addresses.

questions.question: Which type of cloud storage combines public and private cloud storage where some critical information stays inside the enterprise and other information resides outside?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Hybrid cloud storage is a combination of public cloud storage and private cloud storage, where some critical data resides in the enterprise's private cloud and other data is stored and accessible from a public cloud storage provider.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the characteristics of a private cloud?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: An infrastructure provisioned for exclusive use by a single customer
An infrastructure provisioned for use by many customers
An infrastructure owned by several customers
An application owned by a single customer

questions.explanation: A private cloud is an infrastructure provisioned for exclusive use by a single customer.

questions.question: Which of the following is a messaging protocol that uses specifications designed for exchanging structured information in web services and operates independently of the client operating system?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) is a messaging specification designed for exchanging structured information in web services and operates independently of the client operating system.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a set of practices that focus on aligning IT services with business needs?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: The Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) is a set of practices that focus on aligning IT services with business needs.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes SSO?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: SSO allows a user to access an application with a single set of credentials for authentication and authorization.
SSO allows a user to access multiple websites with a single set of credentials for authentication and authorization.
SSO allows a user to access multiple applications with a single set of credentials for authentication and authorization.
SSO allows a user to access multiple applications with multiple sets of credentials for authentication.

questions.explanation: Single sign-on (SSO) allows a user to access multiple applications with a single set of credentials for authentication and authorization.

questions.question: ____________ is the process of transitioning all or part of a company's data, applications, and services from onsite premises behind the firewall to the cloud.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Cloud migration is the process of transitioning all or part of a company's data, applications, and services from onsite premises behind the firewall to the cloud. This enables information to be provided over the Internet on an on-demand basis.

questions.question: Which of the following is a service that replicates data across geographic areas?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: A content delivery network (CDN) is a service that replicates data across many locations.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes mechanisms designed to restrict a list of possible actions down to allowed or permitted actions?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Controls are mechanisms designed to restrict a list of possible actions down to allowed or permitted actions.

questions.question: Why is it important to force all instantiated virtual machines to check current configuration records?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations

choices.text: Documentation is difficult in the cloud.

questions.explanation: VMs are saved as files when not in use; patches can't be applied to these files, so any VM taken out of storage and put into production needs to be checked against configuration versions to determine if there were patches applied to the environment while it was stored. All the other options are distractors.

questions.question: The CSA is _____________________.
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: The world's leading organization dedicated to defining and raising awareness of cloud computing
An international standard for cloud computing
A network standard for converged networks
The Australian standard for privacy in cloud computing

questions.explanation: The Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) is the world's leading organization dedicated to defining and raising awareness of best practices to help ensure a secure cloud computing environment.

questions.question: Which of the following is a suite of extensions that adds a level of security to a vital Internet protocol by enabling response validation?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: The Domain Name System Security Extensions (DNSSEC) is a suite of extensions that adds security to the Domain Name System (DNS) protocol by enabling DNS response validation. Specifically, DNSSEC provides origin authority, data integrity, and authenticated denial of service. With DNSSEC, the DNS protocol is much less susceptible to certain types of attacks, particularly DNS spoofing.

questions.question: Which of the following is a black-box test in which the tool must discover individual execution paths?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Dynamic application security testing (DAST) is a form of black-box application testing whereby the tool must discover individual execution paths. Unlike SAST, which analyzes code “offline”, DAST is used against applications in their running state.

questions.question: Which type of hypervisor has an operating system installed on the hardware and then the virtual manager software installed on top of it?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: A Type 2 hypervisor is one in which an operating system is installed onto the hardware with the hypervisor being installed on top of the OS. These types of hypervisors are thought to be more vulnerable to attack because the attack surface is larger, therefore providing more opportunities for intrusions.

questions.question: Which type of framework contains only the information required for a specific business application to reach a targeted level of trust?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: An application normative framework (ANF) is a subset of an ONF that contains only the information required for a specific business application to reach the targeted level of trust. There is a many-to-one relationship between the ANF and the ONF.

questions.question: Which are the two most widely used API formats?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: APIs are a set of routines, standards, protocols, and tools for building software applications to access a web-based software application or tool. The two most widely used are REST and SOAP.

questions.question: Which type of cloud infrastructure is provisioned for open use by the general public?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: A public cloud infrastructure is provisioned for open use by the general public and may be owned, managed, and operated by a business, academic, or government organization or some combination of them and exists on the premises of the cloud provider.

questions.question: Generally considered a white-box test, which technique examines application code for problems without actually executing the code?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Static application security testing (SAST) is when application code is examined without executing the program.

questions.question: Which cryptography technique destroys data by making it unreadable?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Crypto-shredding is the process of deliberately destroying the encryption keys that are used to encrypt data, thereby rendering it unreadable. This technique is often used in the cloud environment since locating all data fragments and destroying them is effectively impossible due to the nature of cloud computing.

questions.question: Which type of attack occurs when an application receives untrusted data and then sends it to a web browser without proper validation?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: A cross-site scripting (XSS) attack occurs when an application receives untrusted data and then sends it to a web browser without proper validation, allowing an attacker to execute scripts in the user's browser, hijack sessions, or engage in other malicious behavior.

questions.question: Which of the following is not typically included in the list of critical assets specified for continuity during BC/DR contingency operations?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Although cash is important for a business to function in general, it is not one of the critical BC/DR assets, which include personnel, systems, and data.

questions.question: ____________________ describes the relationship between shareholders and other stakeholders in the organization versus the senior management of the corporation.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Corporate governance is defined as the relationship between shareholders and other stakeholders in the organization versus the senior management.

questions.question: What is a primary difference between web hosting and cloud server hosting?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Cloud hosting consists of multiple connected servers providing the cloud-hosting environment.
Web hosting is much more flexible and scalable.
Web hosting offers more control over applications.
Backups are more easily completed with web hosting.

questions.explanation: Cloud server hosting is a type of hosting in which hosting services are available to customers on demand via the Internet as opposed to being provided by a single server or virtual server. In a cloud services model, multiple connected servers that a cloud server comprises provide the hosting environment.

questions.question: The CSA CCM provides which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance

choices.text: A list of fundamental security principles that guide cloud vendors and assist prospective cloud customers in assessing the overall security risk of a cloud provider
Mandates for applying best known security practices
A law that dictates regulated security functions
A list of potential PII data that is subject to protection

questions.explanation: The CSA CCM (Cloud Controls Matrix) provides fundamental security principles that guide cloud vendors and assist prospective cloud customers in assessing the overall security risk of a cloud provider (often in the form of the Consensus Assessments Initiative Questionnaire [CAIQ]).

questions.question: At which layer of the OSI model does an API gateway operate?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: An API gateway runs on OSI Layer 7. The function of a gateway is to solve the problem related to the formatting of datA computer program running on Layer 7 will extract the data in its original format and may reformat the data for use in the lower layers.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes authorization?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: The act of identifying or verifying the eligibility of a user to access a program or process
The act of identifying a person by password
The act identifying a person by biometrics
The granting of right of access to a user, program, or process

questions.explanation: Authorization is the granting of right of access to a user, program, or process. All the other options are related to authentication.

questions.question: The acronym ARO is best defined to represent which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: The number of times a specific type of event or security incident occurs within a 12-month period
The rate of return on a particular project over a 12-month period
The point in time after which a return to operations is no longer feasible
The number of times a security process is optimized or updated in a 12-month period

questions.explanation: The annual rate of occurrence (ARO) is the rate of occurrence of a specific event or security incident one could expect to occur in any given 12-month period.

questions.question: Availability refers to which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: The amount of uptime in any given 30-day period
The amount of uptime specified in the SLA
Whether authorized users can access services and/or data
The amount of uptime promised by the cloud vendor

questions.explanation: Availability, one of the three legs of the CIA triad, represents when services and/or data can be accessed in an authorized manner.

questions.question: The term auditability means which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: A particular service or data that is covered under state or federal regulations
Something being in a state of readiness for auditing
The state of data being covered by audit standards of the AICPA
The AICPA standard for SCO reports

questions.explanation: Something is said to be auditable when it is in a state of readiness for auditing. Cloud providers are often required to maintain a state of auditability as a way of maintaining compliance.

questions.question: What does a cloud provider offer customers?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Access to an IT environment, usually via the Internet

questions.explanation: Cloud providers offer customers access to an IT environment, usually via the Internet.

questions.question: A community cloud has which of the following characteristics?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Differing concerns such as mission, security requirements, policy, and compliance considerations
Exclusive community-based ownership, management, and operation of the environment on premises
Shared concerns such as mission, security requirements, policy, and compliance considerations
Specific security requirements, policy, and compliance implementations for a single customer

questions.explanation: Community clouds are characterized by shared concerns such as mission, security requirements, policy, and compliance considerations. One or more of the organizations in the community, a third party, or some combination thereof own, manage, and/or operate the environment.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes software-defined networking (SDN)?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: Controlling network devices from a single management interface
The idea of using a hyper-converged network model to stream efficiencies
The idea of controlling network provisioning via the hypervisor
The idea of separating the network control plane from the actual network forwarding plane

questions.explanation: SDN is the idea of separating the network control plane from the actual network forwarding plane. This allows for greater control over networking capabilities and for integration of such things as APIs.

questions.question: The SDLC is characterized by which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: The concept of establishing clear phases and methodologies as part of software development
The separation of the management and forwarding planes

questions.explanation: The software development life cycle (SDLC) is the concept of establishing clear phases and methodologies as part of software development.

questions.question: Which of the following models offers the capability of using an application solution running on a vendor's or cloud provider's infrastructure?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Software as a service (SaaS) offers the user the capability of using the vendor's or cloud provider's application solution on their existing infrastructure.

questions.question: Which of the following is not commonly considered a form of privacy data processing?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: Purchasing is not normally an activity related to privacy data processing. All the other options fall into the definition of processing.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes SLE?
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security

choices.text: The amount of expected loss due to any specific single incident
The amount of expected damage or loss due to any and all incidents in a year
The amount of expected loss or damage due to security incidents
The amount of expected damage due to any single storage failure incident

questions.explanation: Single loss expectancy (SLE) is the amount of expected damage or loss from any single specific security incident.

questions.question: Which of the following is a framework that allows a diverse group of individuals to communicate securely?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Public key infrastructure (PKI) is a framework of programs, procedures, communication protocols, and public key cryptography that enables a diverse group of individuals to communicate securely.

questions.question: Confidentiality refers to which of the following?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: The concept of keeping all information secret
The concept of keeping information secret from anyone other than someone with equal or greater access
The concept of keeping information secret from anyone other than someone with authorized access
The concept of keeping information secret from anyone other than the system administrator

questions.explanation: Confidentiality refers to the concept of keeping information secret from anyone other than someone with authorized access.

questions.question: Which of the following describes attributes of public cloud computing?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Minimal management effort and shared resources

questions.explanation: Public cloud computing is characterized by ubiquitous access to shared resources that require minimal management of the shared resources.

questions.question: Which of the following represents the six stages of the data lifecycle in order?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Create, use, store, share, archive, and destroy
Create, store, use, share, archive, and destroy
Create, use, share, store, archive, and destroy
Create, share, use, store, archive, and destroy

questions.explanation: The data lifecycle consists of six stages. In order they are create, store, use, share, archive, and destroy.

questions.question: Which of the following data storage types are used with PaaS?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Platform as a service (PaaS) uses structured and unstructured data types.

questions.question: Where is a NIDS deployed in a cloud or enterprise environment?
questions.subject: Domain 5: Cloud Security Operations
questions.explanation: A network intrusion detection system (NIDS) is deployed anywhere on the network segment being monitored. This can be, but does not need to be, near the network gateway.

questions.question: When using transparent database encryption, where is the engine deployed?
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Transparent database encryption requires the encryption to reside within the database itself.

questions.question: Which of following does not have to occur before an authorized party can formally declare that an organization can return to normal after contingency or BC/DR operations?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Operating conditions have returned to normal.
New measures have been implemented to prevent similar incidents.

questions.explanation: Although implementing new preventative measures might be helpful, they are generally not necessary to resume operations. However, it is necessary to have a high degree of assurance that all safety and health hazards have been abated and operating conditions and risks have returned to normal.

questions.question: Software developers creating products for cloud environments need to consider: _____________
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security

choices.text: The language used in the geographic area of the end user
The shared use of underlying resources
How digital certificates might be used in the cloud

questions.explanation: Shared resources can create the potential for side-channel attacks if the software is not created with the proper controls.

questions.question: Which of the following is one aspect of secure software development for the cloud that should be considered?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: Process isolation can reduce the possibility of side-channel attacks in an environment with shared resources.

questions.question: Which of the following is an attack vector that should be specifically addressed in PaaS environments?
questions.subject: Domain 4: Cloud Application Security
questions.explanation: PaaS environments often include databases; SQL injection is a common form of attacking databases. All the other options need to be addressed in any data center/environment, not specifically PaaS.

questions.question: The organization that publishes the STAR certification program for cloud providers is ___________________.
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: The Cloud Security Alliance publishes the STAR program.

questions.question: What is the organization that publishes and maintains the Common Criteria certification program for IT products?
questions.subject: Domain 6: Legal, Risk and Compliance
questions.explanation: ISO publishes and maintains the Common Criteria program.

questions.question: This type of control might affect the functionality of egress monitoring solutions.
questions.subject: Domain 3: Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security
questions.explanation: Encrypted data may be impossible for the egress monitoring solution to read, thereby making the tool useless.

questions.question: Log data should be protected _______.
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security

choices.text: With controls as or more stringent than the systems being logged
By administrators who are directly involved with the particular clients in question

questions.explanation: Log data is sensitive and valuable and must be protected at a level as high or higher than the systems being logged.

questions.question: Most PII is gathered by ________.
questions.subject: Domain 2: Cloud Data Security
questions.explanation: Most PII is gathered from individuals who voluntarily disclose it.

questions.question: Alice is the CEO for a software company; she is considering migrating the operation from the current traditional on-premises environment into the cloud. Which cloud service model should she most likely consider for her company’s purposes?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: PaaS will allow her developers to create and design their software on a variety of operating systems (OSs), increasing the breadth of the market she can sell to. Also, she can use geographically dispersed programmers to work on projects concurrently, and the provider will be responsible for maintaining and updating the OSs as necessary. IaaS is a less attractive option because it would retain the need for Alice’s company to administer the OSs in addition to building their software; it might be less expensive in terms of paying the cloud provider, but the time and effort and personnel necessary to maintain the OSs would offset that cost, probably in a net-negative way. SaaS is not an option; Alice wants her company to build software, not rent it or buy it. Backup as a Service (BaaS) would not be useful for creating, designing, or deploying Alice’s company’s software.

questions.question: Alice is the CEO for a software company; she is considering migrating the operation from the current traditional on-premises environment into the cloud. Which aspect of cloud computing should she be <italic>most</italic> concerned about, in terms of security issues?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Of these four options, multitenancy poses the greatest risk to software developers in the cloud, because developers need to be concerned with two things: protecting their intellectual property (the software they’re making) and protecting resource calls their software makes to the underlying infrastructure (which, if detectable by other cloud customers, could provide information that constitutes a side-channel attack). Metered service doesn’t pose much of a security risk. The SLA might include some security aspects (such as response time), but it’s usually more of a performance-ensuring tool, and this choice is not as good as option A. Remote access, in this particular case, provides more benefit than risk: Alice can utilize work from developers located across the country or across the planet. While she does have to consider the risks inherent in all remote access, those risks are not as significant as the risks due to multitenancy, so option A is still preferable.

questions.question: Alice is the CEO for a software company; she is considering migrating the operation from the current traditional on-premises environment into the cloud. In order to protect her company’s intellectual property, Alice might want to consider implementing all these techniques/solutions <italic>except</italic> ___________________.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: Turnstiles are a physical security barrier to prevent piggybacking/tailgating (an unauthorized person coming through an entrance behind someone who is authorized), but they don’t really present much protection for intellectual property in this case. Egress monitoring (often referred to as “DLP” solutions) is a great way to reduce the likelihood of intellectual property leaving the owner’s control in an unexpected/unapproved manner. Likewise, strong encryption is useful in the cloud to reduce the impact of theft either from leakage to other cloud tenants or from insider threats (such as malicious admins in the employ of the cloud provider). Finally, digital watermarks aid protection of intellectual property by proving original ownership, which is essential for enforcing intellectual property rights (in the case of software design, mainly copyright protections).

questions.question: Alice is the CEO for a software company; she is considering migrating the operation from the current traditional on-premises environment into the cloud. What is probably the biggest factor in her decision?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Reduced overall cost due to outsourcing administration

questions.explanation: While all of these are traits of cloud computing and will likely benefit Alice’s company, from her position as senior manager of the organization she is likely to consider the financial benefit first and foremost.

questions.question: In which of the following situations does the data owner have to administer the OS?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: With infrastructure as a service (IaaS), the customer (data owner) will administer the OS and applications. In PaaS, the provider will manage the underlying hardware and the OS. In an on-premises enterprise, the data owner is also the system owner and will be responsible for everything. In an SaaS environment, the cloud provider will handle all aspects of processing, except for adding and manipulating the production data.

questions.question: You are setting up a cloud implementation for an online retailer who will accept credit card payments. According to the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS), what can you never store for any length of time?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation: PCI DSS requires that the CCV (or, sometimes, “CVV” for “card verification value”) only be used in the transaction, not stored. The data described in all the other options may be stored after the transaction is complete.

questions.question: The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) distinguishes merchants by different tiers, based on ___________.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Dollar value of transactions per year

questions.explanation: The four merchant levels in PCI are distinguished by the number of transactions that merchant conducts in a year. The dollar value of transactions per year, geographic location, and jurisdiction are not attributes that are evaluated for PCI DSS tier levels.

questions.question: What is usually considered the difference between business continuity (BC) efforts and disaster recovery (DR) efforts?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: BC involves a recovery time objective (RTO), and DR involves a recovery point objective (RPO).
BC is for events caused by humans (like arson or theft), whereas DR is for natural disasters.
BC is about maintaining critical functions during a disruption of normal operations, and DR is about recovering to normal operations after a disruption.
BC involves protecting human assets (personnel, staff, users), whereas DR is about protecting property (assets, data).

questions.explanation:
Technically, BC efforts are meant to ensure that critical business functions can continue during a disruptive event, and DR efforts are supposed to support the return to normal operations. However, in practice, the efforts often coincide, use the same plans/personnel, and have many of the same procedures.
Option A is incorrect; both BC and DR use the RTO and RPO as metrics to determine success.
Option B is incorrect; BC and DR efforts are not specific to the cause of a disruptive event.
Option D is incorrect; health and human safety should be paramount in all security efforts, with very few exceptions.

questions.question: For business continuity and disaster recovery (BC/DR) purposes, the contract between the primary cloud provider and customer should include all of the following <italic>except</italic> ___________________.
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Which party will be responsible for initiating a BC/DR response activity
How a BC/DR response will be initiated
How soon the customer’s data can be ported to a new cloud provider in the event a disruptive event makes the current provider unable to continue service
How much a new cloud provider will charge the customer if data has to be ported from the current cloud provider because of a disruptive event

questions.explanation:
The contract between the cloud customer and current cloud provider has no bearing on what the customer will have to pay to a new provider; that will be governed by the contract between the customer and the new provider.
All the other options are topics that should be addressed in the contract between the current cloud provider and the cloud customer in order to properly address BCDR needs.

questions.question: When the cloud customer requests modifications to the current contract or service-level agreement (SLA) for business continuity/disaster recovery (BD/DR) purposes, who should absorb the cost of modification?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: The cost should be split equally.

questions.explanation: The customer will have to pay for the costs of modification requested by the customer, regardless of purpose. The provider does not absorb the cost when the customer’s requests a modification of the SLA. Though an even split of the cost between customer and provider may seem fair, the customer pays for all costs associated with modifications to the SLA by the customer. Finally, customer modifications to their SLA are chargeable expenses that will almost certainly be paid for by the customer.

questions.question: Which of the following is <italic>not</italic> a factor an organization might use in the cost–benefit analysis when deciding whether to migrate to a cloud environment?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Shifting from IT investment as capital expenditures to operational expenditures
The time savings and efficiencies offered by the cloud service
Branding associated with which cloud provider might be selected

questions.explanation:
The brand associated with the cloud provider should not influence the cost–benefit analysis; the cloud provider’s brand (and even which cloud provider an organization uses) will most likely not even be known to the consumers who have a business relationship with the organization.
All the other options are topics the organization should review as part of a cost–benefit analysis when considering cloud migration.

questions.question: Which of the following is the <italic>least</italic> important factor an organization might use in the cost–benefit analysis when deciding whether to migrate to a cloud environment?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design

choices.text: Shift in focus from IT dependencies to business process opportunities
Whether the provider bills on a monthly or weekly basis

questions.explanation:
The timing of recurring payments to the provider will probably not be a significant factor in the cost–benefit analysis.
All the other options are topics that are more important to review when an organization is considering cloud migration.

questions.question: Which of the following is an aspect of IT costs that will likely be reduced by moving from a traditional, on-premises IT environment into the cloud?
questions.subject: Domain 1: Cloud Concepts, Architecture and Design
questions.explanation:
In a traditional environment, enterprise software costs can be exorbitant, and the price of licensing doesn’t even reflect the hidden costs associated with licensing, such as managing the license library.
